class1.name: Blanche de Bruxelles Mannekin Pis
class1.description: Brewed using 40% soft wheat, Blanche de Bruxelles has a naturally opalescent colour with a very white, dense head.Coriander and orange peel added during wort boiling lend a slight but unobtrusive spiced nose. Although soft and smooth on the palate, as is typical of soft wheat beers, this light and well-balanced white beer is very fresh. Its complex aroma and modest alcohol content make Blanche de Bruxelles a beer like no other.

class1.name: Old Town Ale
class1.description: A light-bodied, easy drinking beer style from the Northern German town of Cologne. The hops are very low and of noble variety with a light malt to keep the beer refreshing.

class1.name: White Chocolate Ale
class1.description: Inspired by the beauty of the White Mountains; the Sonoran White Chocolate Ale is a light, refreshing and completely unique wheat beer. Like a fine chocolate, this brew has a delicate aroma and a subtle taste of white chocolate, which is truly astonishing! For the ultimate experience; pair it with coconut shrimp or lobster. Enjoy one with your meal and another for dessert.

class1.name: Genesee N.A.
class1.description: Make no mistake, Genesee N.A. is a real brew. It’s brewed like a beer, looks like a beer, smells like a beer—and most important—it tastes like a beer. The only difference is it’s non-alcoholic. Brewed with six-row barley malt and a special blend of premium hops, Genesee N.A. is cold aged for a refreshing and full-bodied taste.

class1.name: Brown Ale
class1.description: A session beer brewed with cherry wood smoked malts.

class1.name: Seize One
class1.description: All Colorado-sourced wheat beer fermented with our house saison strain, selected for its bright, fruity and floral esters and subdued phenolics. Highly carbonated and very dry.

class1.name: Lowerline
class1.description: An American-Style Sour ale that is 100% brett/lacto fermented.

class1.name: Shock Top Chocolate Wheat
class1.description: It’s a new flavorful unfiltered wheat beer brewed with a blend of chocolate, caramel and black malts then aged with vanilla and cocoa beans. Every bottle holds a wonderland of chocolaty, beery goodness.

class1.name: Bitburger Premium Pils
class1.description: The classic Bitburger - a mature and most agreeable beer - is brewed with the best of ingredients in the same traditional way it has been for many, many years. The result is delicately tart and pleasantly bitter - with a strong hop taste.

class1.name: Hill Walker Saison - Side Trail Series
class1.description: Some of us at Upland took a hiking trip on the Tecumseh trail in Brown County, Indiana, and while climbing the many switchbacks, we started to crave a good saison. One of 2013′s “15 Beers for 15 Years”, Hill Walker is the refreshing summer-drinking answer to our prayers. This beer features late hop additions and two yeast strains – one to enhance traditional saison flavor, and one to build a crisp finish. Rye adds the perfect complexity to a simple malt base. Fruity yet spicy, this beer finishes dry with subtle hop aroma, a nice peppery rye malt flavor, high carbonation, and lovely effervescence.

class1.name: Banks's Bitter
class1.description: Crafted with the finest ingredients to deliver a really easy drinking beer. A deep gold in colour it comes with malty, hoppy flavours and clean finish with fruity overtones.

class1.name: Silver Back
class1.description:
An intelligently smooth “Black Wit” a new black wheat styled beer. Silky and soft in the mouth and incredibly easy to savour at all times. (4% alcohol)

For the enjoyment of “Mercy”

Inspired by the Honey Badger an animal with cunning intelligence. The honey badger has high economic importance to the farmers. Being omnivorous it preys on a wide variety of prey from disease carrying rodents to destructive insects. It also kills poisonous snakes. It has an intriguing relationship with the honey guide. The bird will lead the honey badger to the beehive and wait for the animal to expose the desired larvae and wax for the honey guide to consume. A secretive and nomadic animal with a wide range which extends outside protective areas where it is heavily persecuted by beekeepers and traditional medicine hunters. It is killed in an inhumane way through gin traps and poisoning.

class1.name: Bathtub Blonde Ale
class1.description: This light and refreshing ale has notes of sweet corn and toasted rice krispy treats!  It's tingly on the tongue and bright at the finish.  Move over bud, this is beer brewed the hard way!

class1.name: Strawberry Ale
class1.description:
Made with Louisiana Strawberries

This year-round-beer favorite combines genuine strawberry puree with a classic Cream Ale to create a uniquely flavorful experience. Very light and easy drinking with a hint of strawberry flavor and aroma. Strawberry Ale is superb with crawfish, salads and desserts, or alone as a refreshing treat.

class1.name: Buxom Blonde Ale (Kölsch)
class1.description:
Our Blonde Ale is an ale, fermented at cool temperatures and cold-stored and aged for about two months. It is subtle, with a light grainy Pilsner malt aroma and flavor. There is a grainy malt sweetness up front, but has a crisp finish so that it never really seems sweet. It is a lower-alcohol beer, approximately Alc. 4.5% by Vol., with just enough hop bitterness to keep things balanced.

Kölsch is the name of the beer brewed uniquely in Cologne, Germany and its neighboring townships and is protected by its name. It is also a word for the German dialect spoken in Cologne and is used as an adjective to describe anything that has to do with Cologne. Unique to Kölsch is that all of the brewers in Cologne, its suburbs, and adjacent towns have unified to stand behind one style of beer with tightly defined parameters. In Cologne, Kölsch is served in cylindrical, thin-walled, seven-ounce glasses, sometimes in a Kölsch Kranz or carrier with 8 or 12 glasses. It is possible to say you have drunk 15 beers in one evening.

class1.name: Pacific Ocean Blue
class1.description: This hop-fueled dark mild, our diminutive take on the popular West Coast hoppy amber style, delivers waves of sticky and juicy hoppiness from Mosaic, Comet, and Citra. We cut back on the alcohol, but kept all the hops and flavor. Farewell my friend Dennis Wilson.

class1.name: Hopsy Dazy
class1.description: Spring Session IPA.

class1.name: Samoan Blonde
class1.description: Brewed with roasted coconut and cocoa nibs, this beer has strong coconut and chocolate character and the aroma is almost porter-like.

class1.name: Alfred's Honey Mild
class1.description: A traditional dark mild ale, with added honey

class1.name: St. Patrick's Best
class1.description: Light and refreshing on the palate, our session best bitter has a classic Irish malt & traditional hop aroma.  Light amber in colour, this smooth beer has hints of caramel with a woody bitterness.

class1.name: Escanaba Black Beer
class1.description: Escanaba Black Beer is malt forward, dark, and delicious. Its moderate roastiness is balanced with a mild hop bitterness. The result is a silky smooth finish for this sessionable ale, making it the perfect beer for anything the north has to offer.

class1.name: Dos Equis Amber
class1.description: A robust, classic Vienna-style lager with a full body. A beer with brawn from Germany, swagger from Mexico, and the finest North American pale and roasted malts. An amber-colored refreshment that’s adventurous enough to be distinctly flavorful. A hot-blooded redhead that’s best enjoyed ice-cold.

class1.name: Southern Grace
class1.description: This style historically comes from the city of Berlin Germany and is a German sour. This light colored ale has hints of lemon and passion fruit with a distinct tartness which makes it the perfect beer for a Deep South summer!

class1.name: Bitburger Bit Cola Libre
class1.description: Mixed beer drink consisting of 60% caffeinated refreshing cola with rum and lemon flavors and 40% beer.

class1.name: Dark Ale
class1.description: This is a very pleasant dark ale. This dark ale has an up front arome of chocolate and good dark malt flavours of coffee and chocolate. Despite being a dark beer, this one has a light body for drinkability.

class1.name: Barking Dog Brown
class1.description: An English Mild/Brown Ale that brings a bit bolder Chocolate-Caramel front yet maintains a very light and friendly, clean and dry, malted milk ball like finish.

class1.name: Long Island Pale Ale
class1.description: A sessionable 3.5% ABV, it’s crisp, dry, and citrusy thanks to a combination of Magnum, Cascade, and Galena hops.

class1.name: Perry
class1.description: Semi sweet with fresh pear flavor, There are also flavors of oak and a slightly sour approach due to 100% oak barrel fermentation.

class1.name: Perfectly Great Amber (PGA)
class1.description: A marvelous, low alcohol “session” beer that’s easy to drink with medium body and just a touch of sweetness for perfect balance. PGA is great for the 19th hole (or any hole in between) or even when you’re just dreaming of those perfect days on the fairway.

class1.name: Valley Brewing London Tavern Ale
class1.description: A classic English Style Mild with a light hop profile. London Tavern Ale is a well balanced beer with caramel flavor and English character. Only traditional English Kent Goldings and Fuggles hops are used.

class1.name: Sea Nymph Summer Ale
class1.description: This light-colored ale goes down smooth and quenches thirst, like summer beer should. Supremely drinkable, Sea Nymph is dry and light, clean and crisp, with a hint of fruit in its nose. Our main goal with this beer is refreshment, so it’s low in bitterness and very effervescent. Enjoy it on the beach, by the bay, or in an air-conditioned sunroom.

class1.name: VB Raw Dry Lager
class1.description: Brewed with nothing artificial. 4 Simple ingredients, nothing atrificial, nothing more to say

class1.name: Henrich's Hard Lemonade
class1.description: A light Malt Lemonaide

class1.name: Elba
class1.description: American wheat ale, spiced with lemon grass, grains of paradise, and bitter orange peel. elba is the first member-owner designed Black Star Co-op beer!

class1.name: Passion Fruit Froctum Bonum
class1.description: “My inspiration for this beer was to make a fruit forward, tart beer, with a dry finish, featuring a favorite fruit of mine.  The tropical acidity is a perfect match for the spicy bitterness of the Saaz hops and the farmhouse style malt bill. – Cory Rossmeissl, our Director and Guru of Sales.

class1.name: Classic American
class1.description: This is our version of the beer your Grandfather drank. Prior to consolidation, American Pilsners were a thing of beauty, the brewers showcase of his talents. Sharing much of its character with its European cousin, the true point of difference of this style is the addition of corn, which lends a slight sweetness, yet not enough to overpower the crisp, herbal hop note. This is an extremely refreshing beer; light in color, crisp in body, and low in alcohol, with just the right balance of malt and hops.

class1.name: Pumplestiltskin
class1.description: A crisp light Belgian Blonde brewed with pumpkin and spiced with clove, cinnamon and nutmeg. The distinctive Belgian yeast is balanced and complemented by the light flavors of Pumpkin and spices.

class1.name: Delph’s Coffee Stout
class1.description: Hands down the biggest beer we have made to date. This is a big stout with lots of big chocolate, roasted grain and dark fruit flavors. After primary fermentation was complete, we added four pounds of local roasted...

class1.name: Honey-Raspberry Ale
class1.description:
This easy drinking beer is made with pale and 
Munich malts, wheat, honey and fresh raspberry puree. Honey Raspberry Ale is refreshing and mildly sweet.

class1.name: Dutch GOLD
class1.description: Dutch Gold is a low-cost, imported, pilsner lager beer sold only in Ireland. It was launched there in 1995.

class1.name: Trauger Pilsner
class1.description: Our Pilsner is assertively hopped with Hallertau and Tettnanger noble hops and has a great cracker-like malt backbone that finishes crisp and dry coming in at 4.4% ABV, which makes this one highly drinkable (which is the point, duh).   We named this beer in honor of the Trauger family of Bucks County who came to America in 1747 and were among some of the earliest German immigrants to the area.  In 1767 Christen and Henry Trauger purchased two farmsteads in Nockamixon Township and have been a part of the fabric of this county, state, and country ever since.  Five generations and 6847 family members later our Head Brewer somehow got lucky enough to be a small leaf of that family tree, and this is our way of looking back not only on that history here in this country, but also our family’s history dating back to Germany.  Ironically enough, the Trauger family’s German heritage predates the introduction and widespread popularity of the Pils style, but nonetheless, this beer is brewed and named in their honor.

class1.name: Hopua Session IPA
class1.description: Hopua is a hop-bursted Session IPA, weighing it at 4.5% alcohol but brimming with fresh hop flavors from a combination of Nelson Sauvin, Ahtanum, Citra and Centennial hops. This beer will have you longing for your adventures with Jimmy and his cat, Poster Nutbag.

class1.name: Harvest Hefeweizen
class1.description: Not just another wheat beer. This award-winning hefeweizen is fermented with an authentic Bavarian weizen yeast to produce its unique flavor profile — fruity, spicy and refreshing. Try it without a lemon!

class1.name: CastagnAle
class1.description: A smooth, defined chestnut beer. The chestnuts are smoke dried on chestnut wood and used in 50% quantity in the beer. The beer has a pale amber color with a very fine ivory head. The nose is lightly smoked with chestnut honey notes. The mouth feel is soft and corresponds to its initial notes.

class1.name: Urban Crusader
class1.description: An Australian style lager, hopped twice.  Use classic Australian Super Pride hops in the kettle, US Nugget hops for bitterness and the German Perle hop for a fruity and spicy aroma.

class1.name: Guilford Golden Ale
class1.description: Light-bodied golden ale brewed with German, English & Belgian hops and malt, yielding a crisp, refreshing finish.

class1.name: King Street Cherry Wheat
class1.description: Looking for something to please the summer crowds? King Street Cherry Wheat may be your perfect match. 240 pounds of all natural Oregon cherry puree was use to make this summer quencher. The cherries complement this Belgian wheat beer's character and aroma. A must have for any deck party.

class1.name: Gambler's Golden Ale
class1.description: A light American, smooth and crisp.

class1.name: Dussel-port Altbier New World Alt
class1.description: Sea Level’s next season speciality is one of Brewmaster Randy Lawrence’s favourites, the recipe given to him from a friend who makes this beer in Dusseldorf, a master brewer at the Fuchschen Brauerei. This New World ALT is a clean medium bodied ale with a background hop presence provided by the Hallertau Saphir hop.

class1.name: Dry-Hopped Pale Ale
class1.description: Our first offering is brewed with English and American pale malts and a blend of Pacific Northwest hops. Expect this session-strength pale ale to have citrus and tropical fruit aromas, backed up by a subtle toasty malt base.

class1.name: Plaid-to-the-bone
class1.description: Plaid to the Bone Heather Ale is a 4.5% abv ale made with heather tips and flowers created especially for the upcoming New Brunswick Highland Games Festival.

class1.name: Mount Hood Porter
class1.description: Brewed with the eponymous hop, Mount Hood provides a soft, sweet smoky tobacco companion to the toastiness desired from a Porter.

class1.name: Sully's Irish Stout
class1.description: Put on your kilt and enjoy this roasted, dark, malty and slightly sweet beer.

class1.name: Koduõlu
class1.description:
Saku Koduõlu on vanade meistrite eeskujul pruulitud mõnusalt tummine ja maitsekas hele õlu. Umbes sellise mekiga õlut pruulisid meie vaarisad kodutalus siis, kui õlletegu veel iga mehe enda auasi oli. Ja just sellisena mäletavad paljud oma vanaisa aetud koduõlle maitset nooruspõlvest suviselt heinateolt. 
 Koduõlle eripäraks on maitse – magusavõitu, hapukas ja väga vähese humalamekiga. Et üks õige koduõlu on alati filtreerimata, muudavad pärmiosakesed õlle välimuselt suduseks ning maitselt veelgi ümaramaks. 
 Koduõlle pruulimiseks kasutatakse pinnakäärituspärmi, mis on sarnane tavalisele „pagaripärmile“, mida kasutatakse kodus maltoosast koduõlle ajamisel. Muus osas on aga Saku Koduõlu pruulitud nii nagu seda aegade algusest saadik on tehtud – alustades linnaste meskimisest ja lõpetades kääritamisega. 
 Selle õige koduse maitse saavutamiseks on Saku Koduõlle pruulimiseks kasutatud nii odra- kui nisulinnaseid. Viimase lihvi Saku Koduõlle maitsele annab tumedate linnaste kasutamine, mis annavad koduõllele veidi tumedama värvitooni ja maitses õrnalt tuntava röstise noodi. 
-- http://www.saku.ee/est/saku-joogid/olled/618/saku-koduolu

class1.name: Patrizia
class1.description: Oyster Stout brewed with bluepoint oysters and roasted malts (from menu)

class1.name: Saranac Traditional Lager
class1.description: A simple well-made Classic American Lager brewed with only choice ingredients. It is extremely mellow refreshingly smooth, glass after glass.

class1.name: Light "Bräu-Weisse"
class1.description: This beer is a relatively dark, yeast cloudy wheat beer that for its low original wort content, has an extraordinarily typical aromatic beer taste and is also rather full-bodied with the first taste. There is also an intensive top-fermented yeasty sensation in taste and smell – a real thirst-quenching alternative and a drink for calorie-conscious, alcohol-reduced enjoyment. Enthusiasts of the light Ayinger “Bräu-Weisse” wheat beer comment: “You think you are drinking a real wheat beer, the light Ayinger Bräu-Weisse has that real full wheat beer taste.”

class1.name: Sissel Tart Raspberry Wheat
class1.description: Pink in color with a bright raspberry flavor and aroma with hints of ruhbarb and bread from the use of wheat.  Crisp and tart.

class1.name: PorkSlap Pale Ale
class1.description: Porkslap Pale Ale is brewed with 2 row North American barley and English crystal malt. The beer is flavored with crystal hop and a touch of fresh ginger to create a distinct flavor only a porkslapper can love. At 4.3% abv this beer is designed to have a good ale flavor and a crisp mild finish.

class1.name: Popsycle Blonde
class1.description: lemon raspberry blonde

class1.name: Ruby Lager
class1.description:
A deep amber hue invokes a refreshing taste in this smooth brew. Slightly nutty, Ruby Lager has a dry finish, leaving one with a satisfying, warm glow, reminiscent of Ruby’s color.
Ruby Lager is brewed with choice imported malts and hops carefully blended together yielding a smooth complex taste for the beer drinker who desires more in their beer.

class1.name: Dockside Blonde Ale
class1.description: The flavor of this American styled Blonde Ale carries itself tall and svelte while maintaining it’s overall looks and wholesome tasting sensation. Five hop additions introduced throughout the brewing process rounds out this beauty for the perfect blend of balanced hop notes.

class1.name: Legless Lal's Winter Ale
class1.description: Unmistakable citrus notes from only the best Cascade hops balanced with a floral aroma and crisp dry finish make this straw coloured ale a fantastic session beer.

class1.name: Calma Muerta
class1.description:
As refreshing as a dip in Barton Springs on a summer day here in Austin, TX, this session Ale has big hop aromas and flavors of lemon, berries, tropical citrus and a light malt backbone to balance it all out. Assertively hopped at 3lbs/bbl with Meridian, Cascade, and Equinox hops, Calma Muerta is a display of balance and drinkability that provides refreshment to all those seeking a quaffable pint of a straw yellow elixir
Key Descriptors – Lemon, Berries, light grain, soft bitterness

class1.name: Log Cabin
class1.description: Log Cabin consists of a malty nose, and light body that sets you up perfectly for it's slightly bitter finish. With it's toned down spices, it will leave you nice and toasty.

class1.name: Beez Neez
class1.description: Hand crafted with pure light amber honey and premium malts.

class1.name: Cascade Head
class1.description: Cascade Head ale, being one of our lightest beers, was named after the National Wildlife Preserve in Lincoln City, Oregon. It is a light, crisp, golden ale and is a good choice for those whose palates are accustomed to America's light lagers. Hopped exclusively with the Sterling and Tettnanger hops, Cascade Head is a refreshing option for those who prefer their ales a little less aggressive.

class1.name: Cream and Sugar Please Sweet Porter
class1.description: This coffee porter is brewed with chocolate and dark chocolate malts to give a robust backbone for the lactose (milk sugar) to build on and is finished with Mazarro's coffee to create a beer with a silky mouthfeel, rich flavor, and the satisfying taste of coffee. 4.9% ABV

class1.name: Fire In The Hole
class1.description: Easy drinking Irish-style red ale that is malt focused with a roasted dry finish. Our Irish-style red ale features a very clear medium to deep amber color with off white head and lace. No hop aroma but very malty with caramel, toffee and aromatic hints of roastiness. Flavor is similar with toasted malt character, sweetness being candy and caramel like. Hop bitterness and flavor being medium with some roasted malt character perceivable. Medium carbonation with mouthfeel and body being the same. Smooth clean finish.

class1.name: Gracchus
class1.description: A collaboration between Omnipollo, Siren Craft Brew and homebrew competition winner Michael Bates. A gently spiced deconstructed gin saison.

class1.name: Harvest Time
class1.description: This is a subtly spiced fall ale brewed with real pumpkin that will evoke memories of holidays and family. It is brewed with our own proprietary blend of spices that will make this one of the best-received pumpkin ales available.

class1.name: Black Irish
class1.description: A proper stout to call our own…this brew is a quintessential Double Mountain interpretation of a classic style. Rich, creamy, roasty and beautifully bitter.  Poured with a thick head, courtesy of nitrogen.

class1.name: English Mild
class1.description: Nitro.

class1.name: Lambrucha
class1.description: Lambruchais a blend of Lambics we select and Kombucha brewed to our specifications. For every batch of LambruchaTM, we must taste and select the Lambics we want to use with the Kombucha produced for us. Lambic and Kombucha are naturally varying products so blending is the essence of how LambruchaTM is made. The Kombucha and Lambic used are living yeast beverages. To our knowledge this is the 1st time 2 living yeast beverages have been combined to create a third, different beverage. For this reason we think LambruchaTM is a truly new drink that combines elements of both Kombucha & Lambic. LambruchaTM is bottled for us by Brj, De Troch, Wambeek Belgium.

class1.name: Antler Brown Ale
class1.description: This traditional American style brown ale has medium body with a sweet Carastan maltiness. A rich deep chocolate color, our Antler Brown Ale is mildly hopped with Mt. Hood hops. Check out the Antler tap handle... locally grown! This has been our most popular beer over the years... a very easy drinking brew.

class1.name: Cooper’s Gold Kolsch
class1.description: This German ale (alt-style) utilizes a unique blend of seven different German malts and two different German hops to produce a golden color—unmatched in its smoothness, with a light, refreshing finish.

class1.name: Pieces of Eight
class1.description: A light refreshing ale, full of hop flavours and a hint of chocolate in the aftertaste. This award winning popular ale gets its name from the famous Pirate Bounty. The term "Pieces of Eight" comes from the looted coins that were cut into eight pieces to use as small change.

class1.name: Samuel Adams Rustic Saison
class1.description: Samuel Adams Rustic Saison is an incredibly complex yet refreshing beer in the classic style of Belgian farmhouse ales. These blonde ales were traditionally brewed to quench the thirst of farmers throughout the summer months. The unique character of our brew comes from its Belgian yeast that imparts floral, fruity, and spicy flavors. These are layered with a slight earthiness and a citrusy, herbal hop character for a bright and satisfying summer brew.

class1.name: Fresh Squeeze
class1.description: A refreshing dark golden wheat-based ale brewed with fresh oranges and milled coriander seeds that combine to create an alchemy of well-balanced flavors.  Subtle banana-like fruity esters give an inviting aroma that is welcoming to both the nose and palate.  The Spinach & Artichoke Dip is great with this beer, as well as our Fish Tacos.

class1.name: Session Brown
class1.description: Award-winning English style mild ale with an incredibly complex array of malt flavors and aromas.

class1.name: Day Trippin
class1.description: Pack the cooler, grab the dog and hop in. That first warm day each Spring gets Floridians all up in a tizzy to spend some time outdoors. We know it all too well. A trip to the springs or a day at the beach is soon to be on the itinerary, and the perfect beer for a day outside is an absolute must. Meet Day Trippin’, our Session IPA brewed with 4 different types of hops and an ABV that will allow you to enjoy a full day of your favorite Florida outdoor activities.

class1.name: Sundowner
class1.description: “An alcoholic drink taken at sunset” OED. Truly a great beer to sup of a summer’s eve. A deep, golden beer. The nose has tropical fruit, pineapple and citrus notes with a smooth maltiness in the background. There is a balanced dry & bitter finish with floral hop aroma. Also available in bottles.

class1.name: Adnams German Style Wheat Beer
class1.description:
This Hefeweizen uses wheat beer yeast, wheat, Pilsner malt, Munich and Cara malts along with Hallaterau hops to give an opaque golden beer with aromas of cloves and bananas. Dry and crisp and spicy on the palate.


Brewed as part of the Handcrafted World beers range, this Wheat Beer follows in the footsteps of examples such as Paulaner Hefe- Weissbier, Schneider Weisse, Franziskaner Weissbier

class1.name: Prost Pilsner
class1.description: Golden, light and unmistakably Pilsner. German Continental Pilsen malts distinctly flavor this bohemian classic, balanced with a heavy accent of Czech Sazzer hops in the finish. Prost! 4.9% Volume

class1.name: Grain Belt Blu
class1.description: A special blueberry variant of Grain Belt originally made for the Minnesota State Fair.

class1.name: S.P.A. Session Pale Ale
class1.description: Point S.P.A. (Session Pale Ale) features 100% Citra Hops. Handcrafted using two-row malted barley, this crisp drinkable Pale Ale has a light malt body and citrusy hop character.

class1.name: Choptank'd
class1.description: Crisp Summer Saison brewed for our friends in Cambridge on the Choptank. Rye, honeysuckle, lemond, and grapefruit peel.

class1.name: Vunderbar!
class1.description: Take a break from the Sturm und Drang of modern life, with this elegant, refreshing pilsner. Our brewers created Vunderbar! with both feet grounded in tradition, focusing on authentic German pilsner malt and spicy Czech Saaz hops. The result just might get you to shimmy into your favorite lederhosen, bust into a quick schuhplattler and loudly proclaim, “Das ist Vunderbar!”

class1.name: Tybee Island Blonde
class1.description: Tybee Island Blonde is a Kölsch style ale.  It is a clean, crisp, session beer brewed with noble hops.  The Blonde has a light floral aroma and a mild hop bitterness.

class1.name: Introvert Session IPA
class1.description: Opinionated and hopped-up, Introvert can easily be misunderstood for having a strong personality. But this artistically complex IPA seeks balance and creative harmony with low ABV and a relaxed pace. Explore Your Introvert, gather your closest friends and explore the possibilities. Hop aromas of tropical papaya and kiwi with woodsy pine, balanced by honey malt and a clean bitter finish.

class1.name: Unfiltered Wheat Beer
class1.description: Boulevard Unfiltered Wheat Beer is a lively, refreshing ale with a natural citrusy flavor and distinctive cloudy appearance. This easy drinking American-style wheat beer has become our most popular offering, and the best-selling craft beer in the Midwest.

class1.name: Fort Tildenist
class1.description: A session white IPA brewed with green tea, and lemon zest. Light, delicate, hoppy notes of melon, tangerine, and basil.

class1.name: “Furbelly” Irish Stout
class1.description: Brewed in the tradition of a true Irish Stout, this jet black beauty bounds with strong roasted malt bitterness and notes of dark chocolate. The low acid, highly aromatic English noble hops impart a medium hop intensity. Oats used in the mash create a nice, smooth creamy body and a thick tan head to round out this creation. A fantastic full bodied drinking experience! Fill up your belly with Furbelly!®

class1.name: Pumpkin Pie Stout
class1.description: Enjoy a taste of this season with this nitro stout that blends pumpkin, brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg. No whipped cream needed

class1.name: Escanaba Black Beer
class1.description: Escanaba Black Beer is malt forward, dark, and delicious. Its moderate roastiness is balanced with a mild hop bitterness. The result is a silky smooth finish for this sessionable ale, making it the perfect beer for anything the north has to offer.

class1.name: Mystic Cherry
class1.description:
It smells fresh and tasty and has the full flavour of summer cherries combined with wheat beer. Mystic lets you enjoy the taste of cherries all year round.
 
Contains 25% cherry juice. Does not contain preservatives.

class2.name: 8 Second Kölsch
class2.description: Head Brewer Christian Koch fell in love with this style of beer while visiting Cologne, Germany. Our 8 Second Kölsch is brewed to be a true representation of this easy drinking crisp ale. First brewed as a special beer for our local rodeo, it quickly became a hit. Now a staple in our core brand, 8 Second is perfect for an everyday craft beer.

class2.name: Lucky U IPA
class2.description:
We like to think this is an ale for everyone who believes you make your own luck. We sure did. And the result is a well-balanced, soulful IPA with just the right amount of hoppiness. An even keeled ale that goes down clean and refreshing, but still lets you know it’s been doted on by the Brewmaster. It's true to it’s IPA heritage, but also highly drinkable. Lucky U. And we seriously mean that.

Yeast: Top Fermented Ale Yeast
Malts: Two Row Pale, Munich, Carmel, Torrified Wheat
Hops: Amarillo, Magnum, Perle, Cascade, Apollo, Fuggle, Goldings

class2.name: Andromeda IPA
class2.description: Hoppy, citrusy, with notes of passion fruit and other tropical fruits. An East Coast style India Pale Ale that is smooth and well balanced, with an intense hop aroma and an emphasis on hop taste, combined with a moderate bitterness.

class2.name: Sweet Magnolia
class2.description: British Crystal and Chocolate malts give this ale a medium body and rich, sweet aroma. Mount Hood hops add a spicy and floral nose. This smooth, malty brew was a Gold Medal winner in the American Brown Ale category at the 1998 Great American Beer Festival.

class2.name: One Hop This Time:  Simcoe
class2.description: Single-hopped IPA bursting with flavors of white peach and juicy red grapefruit. Smooth-sipping, with substantial bitterness and a balanced, resinous finish.

class2.name: Golden Censer
class2.description:
This American Wheat is golden in color with a rich, white head. Aroma rich with orange, citrus and honey. Hop bitterness is mild and in balance with sweet honey malts.

2014 Microfestitvus BEST LIGHT beer award

class2.name: Piece of Cake - Dessert Stout
class2.description: This elegantly delicious sweet stout was created to be the perfect dessert beer. We age our chocolate milk stout on freshly ground coffee, Madagascar vanilla beans, and toasted coconut to represent a similar flavor experience to a German Chocolate Cake. When you find yourself looking for something different, grab a Piece of Cake!

class2.name: Winter Blend
class2.description: Our winter offering starts with fresh apple cider. It is fermented with our ale yeast and aged on toasted oak chips, cinnamon bark, and nutmeg. Not overwhelming on the spice, Winter Blend finishes clean – with enough kick for a cold winter night.

class2.name: Sykophantes
class2.description: In ancient Greece, “showing the fig” was a vulgar hand gesture, and Sykophantes means “one who shows the fig”. Earthy and full of dark fruit flavor from hundreds of pounds of figs and dark candy syrup, but with a sourness that cuts the gentle sweetness, Sykophantes is our fall beer.

class2.name: Schieve Tabarnak
class2.description: La Schieve Tabarnak ! est une bière blonde légère, trouble, aux reflets verdâtres, brassée avec du seigle et une sélection de houblons atypiques, dont du Nelson Sauvin, utilisé en amérisant. Elle présente un nez très floral qui rappelle la rose. Son palais est construit sur trois étages : une entrée qui rappelle le pain de seigle, une évolution verte et fruitée, puis une finale longue et envahissante qui impose au goûteur de s’y replonger aussitôt. Le nom tire son origine, d’une part, d’une insulte bruxelloise (schieven architekt ! ou « architecte de travers »), prononcée par les Marolliens à l’encontre de Joseph Poellart, coupable, à leurs yeux, d’avoir défiguré le quartier avec la construction de son colossale Palais de Justice et, d’autre part, d’un juron québécois qui ne nécessite aucune présentation.

class2.name: Resonation Pale Ale
class2.description: Inspired by our love of music and love for hops, Great Rhythm Brewing Company’s Resonation Pale Ale is our dry-hopped American Pale Ale; balanced, hoppy, full of flavor and aromas highlighting the complex citrus, pine, and floral character of American hops. We use two row barley malt and select crystal malts to lay down a smooth malt profile while we pack a blend of Pacific Northwest hops into the kettle, as well as the fermenter. This is one hoppy American Pale Ale that is sure to resonate with you and all of the friends that you share it with.

class2.name: Crossbuck
class2.description: 2016 FSB Member Homebrew Competition overall winner brewed by Larry Hutson. Roasty stout bittered with Horizon and late-hopped with Cascade. Conditioned on Black Swan white oak for six weeks. Presents a roasted nose, hopppy middle, and a dry, oak-tannin finish.

class2.name: Free Day IPA
class2.description: Free Day IPA is brewed once a year to celebrate Independence Day. Each year, this beer is brewed with a new recipe. This time around, our brewers dry hopped Free Day with Perle, Hallertauer and Fuggle, hops not normally used in IPA. Be Free!

class2.name: Petite Verdot
class2.description: Coming at you live from the mean streets of Bordeaux France is Petit Verdot Grand Gose, an oversized Gose that is designed specifically around its namesake fruit. At first glance the densely opaque violet appearance of the beer hints at a potential fruity potpourri, however; Petit Verdot proves to be more than the uninspired fruity beers being pushed down your throats like bad pop music. Utilizing a grape that most often makes up smaller percentages of wine blends in France, we extract massive leathery notes, hints of tobacco, heavy beats of beets, delicate tannins, jammy notes of raspberries and boysenberries, and then finally a very effervescent cranberry-like finish. A small mountain of French sea salt aids in turning the volume up on the intricate Petit Verdot grape profile and bridging it to the beer's tart and sour base. Petit Verdot Grand Gose is a rare breed; bright and refreshing on its finish making it easy to throw back pints repeatedly, but also a wealth of complexity that can be slowly sipped and analyzed as if you were studying for your Sommelier exam.

class2.name: GINGER
class2.description: A medium-dry cider infused with fresh organic ginger root. Festively spiced, with a clean lemony finish.

class2.name: G-Mac's
class2.description: G-Mac’s Celtic Style Pale Ale is a crisp ale with a citrusy bite and just a hint of sweetness for that perfect balance of flavors. At 5.0 percent alcohol by volume and 30 IBUs, G-Mac’s is drinkable, yet satisfying. And its floral hop flavor provides a snappy finish that’s perfect on the course or in the clubhouse.

class2.name: Scarlet o’ Bretta
class2.description: Drake’s interpretation of a Flanders style sour beer, aged in Chardonnay barrels from Wente in Livermore and inoculated with a blend of house souring cultures to get a mild tartness and traditional funk. The aroma of dark cherries, currants, wine and oak melts with a malt sweetness and Brett funk. On the tongue, the tartness is more apparent, hitting you first, but giving way to a pleasant malt sweetness with hints of cherry cola and Chardonnay.

class2.name: Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbier Urbock
class2.description: A smoked bock beer for Bamberg's strong beer season (October through December). Matured for months in ancient rock-cellars underneath Bamberg and tapped freshly from the oakwood cask. Similar to, but much bigger than the classic Maerzen style.

class2.name: IPA No. 1
class2.description: Nelson Sauvin, Simcoe and Citra star in the numero uno addition of our Collective Project IPA series. These three hops were grown to be together, the New Zealand grown Nelson-Sauvin hops impart a strong fruity flavour with an aroma that resembles white wine, or fresh crushed grapes or gooseberries. Paired with the earthy pine and citrus of the Simcoe hops they commingle with the floral citrus notes of Citra hops. This is one delicious, juicy and slightly dank IPA.

class2.name: Whiskey-Vanilla Smoked Porter
class2.description: A dark, rich, slightly thick porter infused with a classic bourbon flavor. This specialty dark ale is sure to please even the most discriminating palate.

class2.name: Dead Santa
class2.description: Mildly spiced brown ale. Brewed with cinnamon, vanilla extract, and maple syrup.

class2.name: Colchuck
class2.description: Fresh, satisfying, easy drinking, medium bodied golden ale, moderate wheat flavor light hop character, malty sweetness.

class2.name: Cooter Brown
class2.description:
Cooter Brown was a family man who lived on the mason-dixon line during the civil war.  He decided to stay inebriated for the entire war so that he would not need to pick a side. We salute his peaceful manner by naming our brew in his honor.

 

Jekyll Brewing’s Cooter Brown is an American Brown Ale that is smoother than silk.  As you bring our Cooter Brown to your lips, you will smell deep roasty caramel notes as our creamy head embraces your stache.  Once you taste Cooter Brown, you will experience a deep chocolate maltiness and an American hop bitterness balanced to perfection.

class2.name: Cotswold Premium Lager
class2.description: I am malt lead lager with toasted grain flavours & only a hint of sweetness. I was made without any nasty additives or preservatives so I shouldn’t give you a headache! Like any good lager I am lovingly cold stored for at least four weeks to smooth off any rough edges!

class2.name: Daypack
class2.description: Daypack is a hoppy pale ale inspired by the beers we love to take with us on long hikes and treks with one end goal, hoppy refreshment. With a malt bill consisting solely of our base two-row malt, and Marris Otter pale ale malt from England, Daypack remains bone dry with a background of simple bready notes. Its Citra heavy dry hop creates a medley of tropical and dank flavors that jump right out of the beer, only to be followed up with hoppy notes of Asian pear and orange zest. Truly a pale ale best paired with a sunny day.

class2.name: Black Yeti
class2.description: This Stout has a load of late hop additions to bring that zest and poke to the nose. Beautiful delicate coffee and chocolate notes lie in the smooth character of the malts.

class2.name: White Oak Wit
class2.description: Brewed for summers in Houston, this is a beautifully made version of a classic Belgian Witbier. Using wheat malt as the base, coriander and orange peel are added late in the boil. The result is a hazy beer that is light in body, and citrusy with some spicy notes.

class2.name: Due South Category 3 (Cat 3)
class2.description:
Brewed with loads of malts and loads of hops, this golden India Pale Ale is true to the style while maintaining a balance between malty and bitter.  A special blend of American  hops give this beer its unique flavor.  Although fruity and citrusy, this beer has only four ingredients: malt, hops, yeast and water.  

Interesting Fact: This is the first beer Mike ever entered in a homebrew competition and it received an award that day. It was at Havana Hideout in Lake Worth, FL.

class2.name: Biere Royale
class2.description: Biere Royale, modeled after the french cocktail Kir Royale, is a sour ale with black currants. First brewed as a popular draft-only beer for the Portland Fruit Beer Festival, the bottle conditioned version has a bright acidity from a house-grown Lactobacillus culture originally harvested from yogurt. Black Currants are added during primary fermentation to add additional acidity, fruitiness and a deep purple color to the final product. The process was catalogued very well by our friend Sanjay at The Not So Professional Beer Blog.

class2.name: Crackberry
class2.description: Cranberry & blackberry – stripped of all other nonsense. Crackberry is a perfect pairing of flavors tart and sweet, joining forces to create a colorful, well-balanced cider. Frankly, we’re over the moon for it.

class2.name: Red Head
class2.description: This beer is a blonde that is made with four different malts including Rye. Hopped with Amarillo and fresh raspberries to provide further complexities and nuances.

class2.name: Life.Death.Life.Truth
class2.description: Inspired by the Orphic bone tablets which explore the dichotomous nature of life and death, our Bone Tablet series reveals the many sides of the IPA. Life.Death.Life.Truth. is our twist on a Single IPA. With moderate bitterness and notes of gooseberry, sweet orange, and pineapple, Life.Death.Life.Truth. showcases the incredible versatility of hops.

class2.name: The Red C
class2.description:
This is Sloop Brewing’s bold aggressive beer. The Red C contains three different hop varieties that begin with the letter “C”.  The beer has a deep red hue and stands at 6.7% abv.  

Red C pours with a crimson red color and an effervescent white head.  The complex malt flavor comes from a variety of finely kilned grains.  The American hops provide the beer with hints of lemon, mango and citrus flavors.  The clean ale yeast allows your palate to correctly identify all of these complex flavors.

class2.name: 31 Kings
class2.description: This IPA is set apart from others by the beer's powerful aroma that is flowery and herbal with hints of lemon and notes of passion fruit. 31 Kings has a balance of slight caramel malty sweetness that combines with an intense yet rolling bitterness profile. This also sets our IPA apart from others which focus on a punch in the face of hops rather than a harmony of bitterness and flavor. Finally, flavors of pine and orange trickle into the aftertaste allowing a clean and refreshing finish.

class2.name: Winter Ale
class2.description: Winter spiced ale is our winter seasonal offering. With it's thick body, creamy head, ruby hue, and big bold flavors with hints of caramel, toffee, and cinnamon, it is sure to keep you warm through the cold winter nights. Best served at 56ºf in a snifter glass.

class2.name: King's Schilling
class2.description: Hand crafted and meticulously aged in oak, King's Shilling Brandy Barrel Cider is fortified with apple brandy made by Fremont Mischief Distillery.

class2.name: Blatant IPA
class2.description:
Crisp dry aromatic – hazy golden – heavily hopped

“Obviously Hoppy – Definitively Blatant”

class2.name: Oaked Maple
class2.description:
Fermented with raisins and oak chips, this semi-dry cider is back-sweetened with pure Vermont maple syrup. Offering notes of vanilla and oak with a hint of maple, this unique cider is the perfect accompaniment to chilly winter weather. 

APPLES: Smith, Fuji, Red Delicious, Golden Delicious, Gala

class2.name: Barre Blonde
class2.description: Crisp golden ale

class2.name: Dirty Amber Ale
class2.description: A crisp, smooth ale for the masses. Carefully selected malts combined with Centennial and Cascade Hops come together to create our flagship beer.

class2.name: Xtra Pale Ale
class2.description: Easy Drinking American Pale Ale. Hopped with Cascade and Centennial.

class2.name: Replicale
class2.description: Straw color, orange rind aroma, apricot flavor, medium body. Illinois Craft Brewers Guild inspired recipe that was brewed  for the Guild and their loyal patrons.

class2.name: Rousal Bock
class2.description: Our Bock has great tastes of both chocolate and raisins. This beer can be kept in the bottle for a long time and will keep getting better over time due to it being bottle conditioned and has a bit higher alcohol percentage.

class2.name: Royal Virility Performance
class2.description: A beer to stir the loins of newlywed princes, summon the ghosts of long gone princesses and cure the stammer of stuttering kings.

class2.name: Bare Bear
class2.description: A long time ago in Finland, a bunch of Finnish dudes built a sauna. It was nicer in there than it was outside, so they stayed in there until they ran out of beer. When they ran out of beer they still didn’t want to go outside so they decided it would be better if they just started brewing their beer in the sauna. And so began the tradition of brewing this traditional Finnish beer in saunas. Chock full of rye and juniper and spicy yeast esters, our sahti might inspire you to build your own sauna to ride out this winter.

class2.name: There Gose The Neighborhood
class2.description: This was our first collaboration beer with Country Boy B.C. from Lexington KY. This is a German Gose brewed with the traditional wheat, salted water and coriander,with a unique twist of fresh ginger and tart cherries. This beer is tart, sweet and salty with incredible balance. 5.8% and a truly unique brew conjured up by two unique breweries.

class2.name: Spring Bock
class2.description: In Germany, this is a lager that is traditionally brewed in the Spring.Our Spring Bock is brilliant gold in color, brewed with authenticGerman malts, noble hops and Bavarian lager yeast. The wordbock means ‘goat’ in German and is used to describe beers with a kick.

class2.name: Vienna Lager
class2.description: Our interpretation of the classic Vienna lager - pale amber in color, medium bodied, ever so slightly toasty from Munich and Vienna malts, complimented by a grassy noble hop nose.

class2.name: Wrasslers XXXX
class2.description: The real deal. A fulsome full length bitter-sweet stout. The XXXX denotes the strength of alcohol and depth of flavour. Michael Collins favourite tipple by Wrasslers of Clonakilty. A stout like your grandfather used to drink. Late kettle hops produce a forthright aroma, flaked barley lending that rich body, ultimately yielding to the generous roasted grain built solidity of flavour.

class2.name: Hyena
class2.description: A Belgian pale ale brewed with American hops and fermented with Chouffe yeast.

class2.name: Tres Carnales – Pan American IPA
class2.description:
Once upon a time in Mexico 3 brewers met. They shared a common passion. Their love for exceptional craft beer. Over time the brewers became good friends. One day they decided to put their collective beer knowledge together.  Their quest was to create 1 truly outstanding beer. Introducing ìTres Carnalesî. 3 minds. 3 friends. 

1 beautifully crafted beer.

 

With the perfect blend of American and Mexican brewing influence this Pan American IPA is pale orange with copper highlights. The hop character explodes with Mandarin orange aromatics and resinous pine undertones. All from copious amounts of Mandarina Bavaria and Centennial hops.  The malt character is slightly bready. Youíll find mild hints of sweet and tart from the addition of select Blue Agave and Hibiscus flowers. The finish is dry with an assertive yet elegantly refined bitterness from German Magnum hops. 

°salud!

class2.name: Hefe
class2.description: This American style Hefe is brewed with two row base malt, malted, and flaked wheat, with a light hop addition in the finish.  Fermented with an American Hefeweizen strain to bring a fruity, spicy nose.

class2.name: Moonraker
class2.description: The name of this beer comes from a story about a group of farm-labourers who thought that the reflection of the moon in a pond was a lovely truckle of Lancashire cheese, and tried to rake it out but ended up falling in! This reddish-brown beer has a strong, fruity aroma accompanied by a rich, sweet flavour. First brewed in 1950.

class2.name: Falcon Punch
class2.description:
Our gold winning IPA is unlike any other 
you will find. We highlight our favorite locally grown hops in this East Coast IPA. A beautiful golden body with a touch of sweetness from honey malt. 
Falconer's Flight, local Chinook and Cascade hops pack all the flavor and aroma a hop head requires.

class2.name: Hop Project 07270
class2.description:
A single hopped pale ale / IPA hybrid brewed and dry hopped with a new experimental high alpha hop variety, known simply at this point by its hop breeding program number, 07270. 

Derived from a parentage of citrusy Apollo hops & more earthy English Target. Try it out along with us and let us know what flavor and aroma characteristics you discern.

class2.name: Imperialist Pig English Style IPA
class2.description: Reminiscent of the beers shipped to India from England in the 1800′s. Heavily hopped with five separate additions of American Amarillo, Citra & Cascade hops.  This IPA leaves you wanting more.

class2.name: Smoky Bob
class2.description: In Northeast Bavaria, one of the local specialties is Rauch, or smoked, Beer.  We decided that it would be fun to see what we could do with this style.  While not as smoky as some beers from Germany, this beer shows a little smokiness in the nose, along with some malty notes (there were no finishing hops in this beer, so no hop aroma).  On the palate, the malt and smoke interplay with each other, with the dextrins combining with the smoke to bring out an almost bacon-y flavor.  The finish is crisp and savory, inviting you back for another sip.  (1.014 BG, 5.25%, 25 IBU, 9 SRM)

class2.name: Old World India Pale Ale
class2.description:
This bottle contains an India Pale Ale from a bygone era. An era of towering sailing ships, burgeoning empires and world shaping beers. This is an ale hand crafted with British malts and English hops to recreate the epic IPAs that were sent on monumental ocean voyages from England to India by sea in the 1800s.

Old World IPA is an attempt by punk post modern Scottish Brewers to pay tribute to a 200 year old odyssey and heritage with a healthy dose of swash-buckling adventure.

class2.name: Syd Strongs
class2.description:
We were asked by BrewDog Camden to collaborate with them on a beer for Collab Fest; an annual event when BrewDog bars choose a local brewery to work with on producing a beer. We wanted to go dark because of Camden’s association (at least for us) with Goths. The guys at Camden wanted to add a bit of spicy rye malt and the result is Syd Strong’s a black IPA brewed with rye malt and U.S. hops.

We named the beer after an old barber’s shop that used to be on Camden High Street when Sam and Graham were in their pomp (a long time ago). Amazingly our graphic designer Francis managed to find an old picture online showing the front of the shop. Even more amazingly the owner of the website kindly allowed us to use the image on our label. The website is an amazing archive of vintage photos of London taken by John Sweetland who’s son David now blogs about London using his Dad’s photos as a starting point. It’s well worth looking at.

class2.name: Hop Harvest
class2.description: Our Hop Harvest Ale celebrates the bounty, aroma and freshness of the hop-growing season with an abundance of American hops fresh from the farm.  Standing on a lightly caramel malt base, the hops this year offer a rich mix of floral and fruit notes balanced by underlying citrus and pine.

class2.name: Cowboy Common
class2.description: Similar in style to a steam beer, our Cowboy Common uses a traditional lager yeast but is fermented warm at ale temperatures.  Norther Brewer hops offer a woody/minty taste to balance the bready Victory malt.

class2.name: Lemongrass Rice Ale
class2.description: This beer was inspired by the unique spice blends in Thai cuisine and is as versatile in matching up with those flavors as a Thai menu is (often) overwhelming. You know what to drink, so the trick will be deciding on what to order.

class2.name: Merry Buffing Christmas
class2.description:
Piney and resinous with a bit of spice from the rye, you'll want this beer full of holiday cheer and our Christmas present to Houston: a rye IPA with spruce tips.

It's dank with a subtle citrus nose. Fresh spruce tips give a strong pine forward flavor and Chinook and Amarillo hops meld with the rye to brighten up the finish with a nice bit of spice.

class2.name: White Lightning
class2.description: 2012 GABF Bronze Medalist.  This Belgian-Style White Ale combines a complex malt character with sweet orange peel, coriander and grains of paradise.  The end result is a shockingly refreshing wheat beer that can be enjoyed all year long.

class2.name: Mach Schnell!
class2.description: Featuring bready European malts and spicy/oral continental noble hops, this German-style pilsner is a crisp, refreshing, true lager with plenty of Old World charm. Fizzy yellow beer? Jawohl!

class2.name: Fünke Hop Farm
class2.description: Who's got the fünke? This farmhouse style fünke saison certainly does; a unique blend of barrel-aged brew made in locally sourced Petite Syrah and Grenache wine barrels. Carefully crafted with a final round of dry-hopping to bring out the distinct notes of citrus and stone fruit. Enjoy with good company and savor the fünke. Prost!

class2.name: Summer Bock
class2.description: Rich in flavor from German pale barley. Moderate noble hop character with a subtle spicy quality from hops and alcohol. German Lager yeast provides a smooth long clean finish that interplays the malt and noble hops.

class2.name: Oktoberfest
class2.description: Our 2014 Festbier! We brewed this amber lager back at the beginning of July in order to give it enough time to condition in our lager room. A smooth, traditional Märzen-style Festbier to be released just before the cooler days of Fall arrive. Malty, caramel body with a hint of noble hop bitterness for a balanced finish. 5.5% ABV

class2.name: Smoked Lager
class2.description: Our slightly smoked Helles-style lager contains all American ingredients including Briess malt smoked with cherry wood. Rich malts and smooth hops give way to a smoky finish reminiscent of the old Bamberg style rauch biers.

class2.name: Fuzzy Farmhouse
class2.description: A farmhouse ale made with peaches.

class2.name: Hawaii Toad Ohh Pineapple
class2.description: Cold weather is here so we are serving a glass of sunshine at the Toad! Splash a wave of refreshment on your Holiday fun with Blue Toad’s Pineapple Hard Cider, a new seasonal flavor mixing the smooth, citrus taste of fresh Hawaiian pineapple with the crisp, tart sweetness of apple cider.

class2.name: Rising Rainbow Pale Ale
class2.description: A light crisp pale ale, lightly hopped and malted makes for a great spring Pale

class2.name: BROHIO
class2.description: Collaboration with North High Brewing. With prickly pear and Hibiscus.

class2.name: Oatmeal Stout
class2.description: Velvety smooth, with almost a ¼-cup of oats in each pint. The Scottish pale malt and roasted barley combine for a black, slight roast hint that’s surprisingly drinkable. The oats contribute a rich creaminess. English fuggle hops balance the slight sweetness.

class2.name: Mother Pucker
class2.description: Sour witbier with blueberries

class2.name: Zeus Will Smite Thee
class2.description: Zeus is a full flavored well balanced IPA. Pale Ale and rye malt provide the backbone of this beer while a blend of Galena, Zythos and Ahtanum hops give it a balanced citrus tangerine flavor.

class2.name: Spring Bock
class2.description:
A traditional German style lager. Characterized by a deep copper color and rich malt flavor. Balanced with German hops.

Available at the Brewery and in bottles & cases from March - May.

class2.name: Oktoberfest
class2.description:
The Oktoberfest or Marzen (March) type of beer was originally brewed in March, and laid down in caves before the summer weather rendered brewing impossible. Stocks would be drawn upon heavily during the summer, and exhausted by October.

In Germany, this tradition has come to be associated with one specific style, Oktoberfest Bier. In keeping with true German tradition, August Schell Oktoberfest beer is brewed just once a year. Brewed with the perfect balance of Pale, Munich, and Cara Pils malt with Liberty and Perle hops to create a rich, smooth taste.

class2.name: Snake Oil
class2.description: Just like the miracle cure-alls of old, Imperial Pilsner possesses no verifiable medicinal qualities whatsoever. And yet, taken internally, this golden elixir is guaranteed to cure what ails you. Snake Oil is a crisp, Medium-bodied lager with a complex maltiness, heavy hop presence, and crisp, refreshing finish. First brewed in 2005, we stopped filling prescriptions for our Imperial Pilsner in 2008. But fear not, Snake Oil could return at any time, so wait patiently and don’t settle for generics.

class2.name: Jolly Tar
class2.description:
The Jolly Tar name is inspired by one of the famous rye whiskeys produced by the Altschul Distilling Co. founded in 1862 by Samuel Altschul Sr., an immigrant from Germany. The distillery was located in Springfield, O and featured more than a dozen brands, including Jolly Tar Rye. His flagship label was Old School Rye which was derived from the English translation of his last name Altschul. He styled this whiskey “pure and potent.” 

 

Jolly Tar is dark brown with ruddy highlights and has a subdued hop character with a mildly assertive finish. The aroma is malty with lots of baker’s chocolate and mild raisin-like notes. The aroma flows into the flavor of the beer with chocolate, raisin and fig like character. The mid palate is malty with medium body that finishes somewhat dry.

class2.name: Never Say Die Rye
class2.description:
Where civilization is established rye will follow. In early farming communities rye was considered a weed of the wheat crops that maintained entire villages. When rye was discovered to be a nutritious and hardy grain its cultivation became more purposeful.
A hazy golden straw color and eggshell white head parade our rye session ale onto the scene with old fashioned gusto. Holding true to its historical character a spice snap is presented with the first sips and continues throughout. This beer is full and round in mouth feel; a slight hint of bitter sweet orange pith softening the rye and provides balance. A crisp and very dry finish reiterates the rye spice and pleases the palate. Cheers!

class2.name: The Cream Ale
class2.description: This easy drinking beer is smooth and creamy. It is well balanced with a low to medium body and medium hop profile

class2.name: Woodhead Amber Ale
class2.description:
Our take on the “Red Ale” of the United States’ Pacific Northwest, the Woodhead Amber Ale is as delicious as it is beautiful. A slightly hoppier finish than is typical of many South African examples which leads to superior sessionability.
Woodhead is the name of one of the five dams built on Table Mountain at the turn of the 20th century to supply water to Cape Town. A landmark and feat worthy of continued recognition.

class2.name: Albino Stout
class2.description: For all of you that drink with your eyes. A full bodied white oat ale with chocolate and coffee overtones.

class2.name: 1060 EZ
class2.description: Brewed for tax day each year, 1060 EZ is a high gravity golden ale brewed with flaked corn, whose deep golden color and aroma of corn grits complements the light body and flavor notes of cornbread and honey.

class2.name: Oompa Loompa Chocolate Stout
class2.description: Our English Sweet Stout brewed with 22 pounds of Belgian bittersweet chocolate and aged with 10 pounds of cocoa nibs and Madagascar vanilla beans for a cold weather treat.

class2.name: Harvest Pale Ale
class2.description: A chewy and rich pale ale hopped with Magnum, Cascade, and Sterling. Caramel and malt-candy notes blend with a stone fruit, tangerine, and dark berry fruitiness and finishes with a gentle yet crisp bitterness.

class2.name: Lookout Pale Ale
class2.description: Lookout is a refreshing American Pale Ale with an orange blossom hop character and a clean malt body. The perfect companion for piloting a river.

class2.name: Altenauer Frühlingserwachen
class2.description: In our Altenauer springbok, hop-aromatic freshness is combined with a touch of malty sweetness. Aromamalts give it its reddish color and sweetness, which spreads pleasantly on the tongue. The finest aroma pots provide a harmonious citrus freshness in the antrunk. These exquisite ingredients make the Altenauer Springbok a unique Harz beer specialty.

class2.name: Claim Jumper IPA
class2.description: A classic American IPA made with classic American ingredients. A blend of Columbus, Nugget and Galena provide a firm, bitter base that bears the full load of piney, grassy notes and deep hop flavors you expect from an IPA. The rocky, white head helps loft all those wonderful aromas right up to your snooter – so drink up!

class2.name: Aarghtoberfest
class2.description: Our AARGHtoberfest! is a rich and toasty lager with a color reminiscent of the fallen leaves of October. A subdued earthy hop character helps to balance this malt forward beer. This beer is only available from August through September.

class2.name: Galaxy
class2.description:
Style: Single Hopped Saison 
Brewing single hopped Saisons gives us the opportunity to focus on the unique qualities of one hop and we are able to accentuate the best characteristics of that single ingredient. Galaxy hops are known for their tropical fruit flavors, so we added passion fruit juice, just for fun!

class2.name: Saison
class2.description: Light and refreshing with hints of citrusy hops and spice from the yeast.  Slightly cloudy and golden in appearance.  Finishes slightly dry to leave you wanting more.

class2.name: L'Abondance
class2.description: Peppery Saison yeast meets floral, citrusy hops. Dry hopped to add a juicy character to this classic farmhouse style.

class2.name: O-Town Brown Ale
class2.description: Moderately hopped with organic Golding hops, our English style Brown Ale has a toasty, nutty taste. This beer is slightly malty and contains notes of caramel and hints of chocolate.

class2.name: Wild VIII
class2.description: Oak-Aged Wild Ale with Brettanomyces and Cherries.

class2.name: Thoroughbred
class2.description: Bourbon Barrel Aged Kentucky Common

class2.name: Blue Testament
class2.description: Crisp, light, with a sweetness brought in by the Texas-sourced blue corn, this beer is perfect for daily drinking and taking to your favorite summer body of water.

class2.name: Birthday Suit  24th Anniversary Sour Cherry
class2.description: Lightly sour blonde ale with Montmorency cherries.

class2.name: The Harry Oyster Stout
class2.description: 480 Willapa Bay oysters smooths out the roast profile of this Irish Dry Stout for a truly sublime drinking experience. This beer is an Agrarian Ales and Corvallis Brewing Supply collaboration with oysters from Harry and Annette's Fish Market.

class2.name: Powder Run Pale
class2.description: A hop forward American Pale Ale with big citrus flavor and aroma

class2.name: Chief Sawnees's Stash Coconut Porter
class2.description: We take the Sawnee Mountain Porter and added toasted coconut flakes, caramelized dates, and vanilla bean to create a beer so good, even Chief Sawnee would hide it in his cave.

class2.name: Shucker Stout
class2.description:
Shucker Stout is dark and full of complex roasted/coffee/chocolate flavors. It’s brewed to ferment very completely to result in a dry and easy drinking finish. This stout is not motor oil. It won’t make you feel full after drinking just one but still carries a full spectrum of flavors and complexity. Shucker Stout is technically classified as a Dry Stout and, at just over 5% ABV, is light enough to enjoy over and over again.
 That all sounds great, but… Shucker Stout? Heck ya! Oysters are the most classic example of food pairings with Stout and the Chesapeake Bay is world famous for our oysters. A shucker is the term for the person who opens oysters as well as the name of the knife used to do the job. So there you go, Shucker Stout! Enjoy!

class2.name: Sparky
class2.description:
Our garage was a pretty crowded space. Toys, tools, brewing equipment, and even the family sedan when we could fit it in. Probably no different than your garage. So with space at a premium, there was no room for junk. Everything had to perform. Like that pair of jumper cables over there. When we need them, they get the job done, providing a spark to start something fresh, something new, shared among family, friends, even a stranger in need. So here’s to providing a spark when called upon, no matter who needs it. That’s why we call this this hoppy wheat ale Sparky. And always remember, red to positive.

Sparky Hoppy Wheat Ale is a true-to-style American wheat beer. Unlike the common German Hefeweizen which features banana and clove yeast aromas and flavors, this beer features a clean American ale yeast. This single Cascade hop brewed beer focuses on being hop forward with a nice malt background support the hops and keep the beer well-balanced. This hop is citrus and pine forward. Sparky finishes dry, clean and crisp.

class2.name: Bretty Grable
class2.description: Collaboration saison with local homebrewer and microbiologist, Mark Trent. Using a unique blend of yeasts from two famous Belgian breweries, this farmhouse ale gets its signature "funk" and barn-like authenticity from secondary fermentation with Brettanomyces.

class2.name: Alice
class2.description: Alice has quickly become a favorite of staff and customers at our original Brooklyn Neighborhood location. The cider is made entirely from estate grown Granny Smith apples. The result is a clean, crisp, tart cider that can appeal to just about any customer.

class2.name: 80 SHILLING
class2.description: Our 80 Shilling is deep red in color and very malt accented. Very little hop flavor or aroma is evident. It is basically our Scottish Ale’s little sister. This ale is lower in alcohol than the Scottish Ale. To give this beer caramel flavor, Our Brewmaster took a portion of the first runnings of wort and transferred it to the kettle.The Brewmaster then boiled these runnings for an hour to caramelize and reduce the wort. This gave the beer a nice caramel flavor. Scottish breweries list their products in ascending order of gravity and strength as Light, Heavy, Export                                  and Strong. In the past, beer in Scotland was taxed based on strength, so the                                      beers became known by their tax ratings: 60 shilling, 70 shilling, 80 shilling, 90                                    shilling. Alcohol content by volume might rise through 3, 4, 4.5 and 7-10.

class2.name: Yearling Flanders Red Ale
class2.description: An American sour ale in the Flanders Red style. Aged in wine barrels for a year, this tart and complex beer has aromas of plum and sour cherry, with flavors of ripe fruit and subtle caramel malt. Dry and refreshing with an oaky finish.

class2.name: Bootlegger Brown
class2.description: Smooth, chocolatey, and easy-drinking.... Brewed with the finest two-row barley and Belgian chocolate malt, Bootlegger has a distinctive, chocolatey flavor. Bootlegger is medium-bodied and filtered for a clean, laid-back finish.

class2.name: Not So Old Bohemian Pilsner
class2.description: Pilsner and Vienna malts make this a true craft lager  (yea, yea, we know it’s the yeast that makes it a lager); you won’t find corn or rice in this Bohemian-style Lager.  In true Bohemian style, this light lager is brewed with Czech Saaz hops.  One of our lightest brews, this one is especially made for drinking all summer long.

class2.name: Global Warmer
class2.description: ...how did we end up in this situation? Plenty of blame to go around for sure, but we're going to have to formulate our way out of this mess. Beer climates change, seasons creep but the liquid must remain cyc. Hey man, it is all about the %*@#ing formulation. Now that's Mad Science.

class2.name: 30th Anniversary
class2.description:
Nearly 300 years ago, 100 families left Belgium for a new life in Louisiana, settling near New Orleans. Their ship, La Loire, is sometimes called the Louisiana Mayflower. This Belgian-style IPA is a tribute to those settlers. Made with pale, pilsner, and wheat malts, it is hopped and dry hopped with German Hallertau Blanc hops for a pleasant bitterness and the aroma of grapes and fruit. Belgian yeast adds to the fruity aroma. 

30 years ago Abita Brewing launched the craft beer revolution in Louisiana. For three decades, Abita has proudly brewed full-flavored ales and lagers for the way we love to live in Louisiana.

class2.name: Appalachian Amber Ale
class2.description:
Thomas Creek Amber is a full-bodied ale with malty flavor, rich caramel color, and a smooth aromatic finish. 

Malts: 2 Row Pale, Carapils, Carmel 40, Carmel 60, Black Patent
Hops: Hallertauer, Tettenger, East Kent Golding

Silver - 2008 Carolinas Championship of Beers
Gold - 2006 Carolinas Championship of Beers
Silver - 2003 Carolinas Championship of Beers

class2.name: Kill Your Idles: Pluot
class2.description: Sour ale w/ plum, apricot and lactose added. Slightly tart, fruity and sweet.

class2.name: Good Question
class2.description: What do you call a hybrid between a British pale ale and an American pale ale...good question! Marris Otter gives this beer a toasty base. American hops  and English yeast finish out the ale to give it a perfect blend of tosty malts and clean hop bite.

class2.name: Bretticent Wild Ale
class2.description: This traditional saison is brewed using North Carolina grown barley, wheat, and rye from Riverbend Malthouse and is open fermented. The beer is then finished with Brettanomyces.

class2.name: Four Star Pils
class2.description: This golden-hued pilsner has a light, fresh body and clean finish. Bright, refreshing carbonation mingles with German and American hops to give this pilsner a unique Goose Island spin.

class2.name: Nettle-Ginger Saison
class2.description: Belgian farmhouse ale bittered with nettle and ginger. No hops.

class2.name: Snow Weasel
class2.description: Named after a top-secret white tank made by Studebaker for the US Military in the 40s, this dry-hopped malt porter will keep you nice and warm.

class2.name: Oatmeal Stout
class2.description: An aromatic blend of oats, chocolate and roast malts make up this classic English-Style Oatmeal Stout. A rich black over ruby hue and creamy tan head make our stout a memorable beer to behold.

class2.name: I-10
class2.description: The West Coast comes to Jax with this extremely hoppy, true India Pale Ale. Our two-row malted barley and caramel malt come to life with a ?@!#-ton of Northwest hops. We use 4 different hops during the brewing process and during dry hopping. It’s music to your nose.

class2.name: Humboldt Haze Imperial Wheat IPA
class2.description:
From the heart of the Emerald Triangle, Humboldt Haze Imperial Wheat IPA is a flavor packed hop odyssey with the rowdy character of the west coast style. 
 
Brewed as an over the top high gravity American Wheat ale, Humboldt Haze pours a deep burnished golden orange with a brilliant white head. Bounteous aromas of exotic tropical fruits and citrus reign, while a subtle balm of toasted wheat and caramel malts heighten anticipation of the first sip. Resinous explosions of hop bitterness are soothed and harmonized by the silky characters of light, sweet wheat and mild caramel flavors. Then it’s on to a massive fruity cornucopia of citrus, passion fruit, mango and papaya with hints of white grape, lychee and pine. The boldly hoppy and resplendently balanced finish entices you back for more… and more… fascinating the senses anew with each savor. Enjoy!
 
Malts: 2-row Pale malt, White Wheat, Crystal Wheat and Aromatic
Bittering hops: El Dorado and Centennial
Flavor Hops: El Dorado and Centennial 
Finishing Hops: Crystal
Dry Hops: Crystal and Citra

class2.name: Chaider
class2.description:
Chaider is our annual Chai Spiced Hard Cider. We collaborate every year with Dragonfly Chai, a specialty tea microbrewery in Portland, Oregon, to produce this rooibos rich, chai-forward, autumn-magic in a glass.
So grab a chai, curl up in a blanket or go kick some leaves!

class2.name: Workingman's Rye Stout
class2.description: An old fashioned stout with lots of flaked barley, roasted barley & rye malt, perfectly balanced by nugget and perle hops.

class2.name: fľaša svetlé pivo
class2.description:
12% svetlé pivo Zlatý Bažant je svetlý ležiak plzenského typu.


Je charakteristické jemnou chmeľovou arómou a stredne silnou horkosťou. Plná chuť a primeraná rezkosť ho zaraďujú medzi najobľúbenejšie pivá na trhu.

 Je hlavným nosným sortimentom pivovaru Zlatý Bažant, známym takmer na celom svete. Elegantná etiketa a zlatou šatôčkou obalené hrdlo špeciálnej zelenej fľaše dáva produktu skutočný ráz exkluzivity.

class2.name: Hail the Pale
class2.description: Hail The Pale is our interpretation of the American Pale Ale. It mostly comprises pale malt, but also includes some caramel malt for a touch of sweetness. It is hopped with Simcoe, a hop that we have not used in any of our other beers, which lends its unique flavor and strong floral aroma.

class2.name: Father
class2.description: Father’s home, and his big, brawny body fills the room with a ruddy glow. He brings us gifts of dark roasted malts with hints of caramel and nuts, and bitter Belma hops that conjure up strawberries and plums. We promise we’ll save some for later. But he knows we won’t.

class2.name: Winter Run
class2.description: A hop forward, medium bodied, India Pale Ale.  The strong hop flavor is from the use of the choicest Pacific Northwest hops; lending to a balanced bitterness of citrus, floral, and hints of tropical fruit characteristics.

class2.name: Freya's Stone Amber Ale
class2.description: Our Amber Ale is a slightly roasty, slightly caramely and deliciously malty take on American craft beer. We brew this with a 100% barley grain bill consisting of various Caramel roasts.  We use a generous amount of American hops for bittering and aroma without upsetting the balance of the beer. Truly a beer for all seasons, with a mix of great flavor and accessibility, you’ll love the change of pace from lighter beers.

class2.name: Weissbier Dunkel
class2.description: Andechser Weissbier Dunkel has been the perfect completion to the Andechs monastery brewery’s range of products since 1997. This dark Weissbier retains its aromatic character thanks to the select choice of Hallertau aroma hops and highest quality Bavarian wheat and dark barley malts. Its characteristic, distinctive maroon colour is a feast for the eyes. Then there’s the opalescence and fine structure of the yeast turbidity. The perfect complement is provided by the very creamy, fine pored head. This dark Weissbier from the Holy Mountain will delight connoisseurs with a harmonious interplay of fruity odours, above all ripe bananas and pineapple, with undertones of caramel and cocoa. Andechser Weissbier Dunkel teases the tongue with a delicate tanginess carried by a round, soft body. A light caramel sweetness harmonises well with the fine hoppy bitterness. It concludes on a soft and refreshing note (original extract: 12.5%, abv: 5.0%).

class2.name: Summer Solstice
class2.description:
This copper colored ale is smooth, malty, and lightly sweet, with a delicate hint of spice for that oh-so-drinkable, extra velvety flavor. The character is lighter in body than its cousin, our wildly popular Winter Solstice Seasonal Ale . This is a silky, creamy dream, perfect as a warm weather beer. But why call it Cerveza Crema? Two reasons: One, this beer has become a favorite among many of our Hispanic friends, so it’s named in their honor. Two, it sounds cool, and cool is what you want when its hot. Serve at 40 to 45 degrees Fahrenheit for the most optimal flavor and enjoyment. ¡Salud!


As with all of our products, Summer Solstice Seasonal Ale is never sterile filtered nor heat pasteurized, and should be stored in refrigeration. However, to fully enjoy its rich and complex flavor, it should be served between 40° and 45°F

class2.name: British Volunteer
class2.description: Our story begins here with our flagship beer. British Volunteer epitomizes perfect balance. A strong malt backbone blends perfectly with traditional English hops to create a very easy drinking and endlessly satisfying ale. With our pints raised, we proudly name our ESB after the pub in Ashford, Kent, once run by Grandpa Pocock’s family.

class2.name: Cherry Bomb
class2.description: A blend of our award winning hard cider, made with Michigan tart cherries and lemon to create a refreshing adult cherry lemonade.

class2.name: The Astounding She Monster Mango IPA
class2.description: Our juiciest beer features ripe mango and tropical hop aroma on the nose followed by a mild bitterness from the Citra and Falconer's Flight hops and some alcohol warmth to balance out the sweetness of the fresh mango.

class2.name: Albatross Pale Ale
class2.description: You’ve heard of a Birdie. Even an Eagle or a Hole In One. But what about an Albatross? That’s three shots under Par; as rare as the Albatross itself. Matt Swihart teamed up with some folks from Point Blank Distributing to put together a refreshing pale ale. It sits light on the tongue, and finishes dry and refreshing. Lemon and raspberry sit on the top, and it continues a light effervescence accented with citrus and a lemon tanginess. There wasn’t much made. You might say it’s as rare as an Albatross.

class2.name: Escape Artist
class2.description: We believe beer is magic! Escape Artist Extra Special Pale will make you a believer as well. A light, medium-bodied brew, we use two classic American hops varieties. Centennial and Cascade create a concoction of mystique and complexity. No smoke and mirrors here.
