class2.name: Oak Creek Amber Ale
class2.description:
This beautiful amber beer is a malt dominated brew, featuring biscuity, bread-like malt cleanliness. A nice mild, Hallertau noble hop flavored bitterness fills in the background.

Silver Medal Winner at the North American Brewers’ Association competition.

class2.name: Shoofly Wheat Ale
class2.description: Equal parts of malted wheat and pale malt plus Sterling and Czech Saaz hops go into our simple refreshing summer ale.

class2.name: Alternating Current
class2.description: Gizmo Brew Works ushers in autumn with its newest seasonal, an altbier. Brewed true to the German style, this crisp amber ale is malt-forward, exhibiting a sweet caramel flavor accentuated by a light touch of spicy Noble hops.

class2.name: Belgian Amber
class2.description: This striking Belgian Style Amber ale gets its color and flavor from over six varieties of malted barley. Toasted malt dominates the flavor profile, but subtle sweetness lingers to provide a rich mouth feel that is extremely smooth and drinkable.

class2.name: Grateful Red
class2.description: While the fiery red hue may deceive you of its inherent hoppiness, the play of toasty malt flavors with sharp, resiny hops will bring you to the strangest of places, if you’re drinking it right.

class2.name: Black Sun Stout
class2.description: A nose of coffee, roasted malts and piney hops. This medium-bodied stout has a broad depth of maltiness and a clean, dry finish.

class2.name: Pale As Night
class2.description: A beer from the San Diego days created with Justin Knight.

class2.name: Shiner Wild Hare Pale Ale
class2.description: Wild Hare is a classic American Pale Ale-richly hopped, fruity and floral. Munich malt nicely balances the assertive character of the U.S. Golding and Bravo hop varieties that give this brew its signature bitterness and aroma. Enjoy!

class2.name: Heart's Delight
class2.description: Aged in used wine barrels for 16 months with tart cherries.

class2.name: Angry Amber
class2.description: A low gravity, Amber Ale focusing on hops rather than malt contribution. Simcoe and Cascade make up the Hop Bill on this brew.

class2.name: Summer Bock
class2.description: Rich in flavor from German pale barley. Moderate noble hop character with a subtle spicy quality from hops and alcohol. German Lager yeast provides a smooth long clean finish that interplays the malt and noble hops.

class2.name: Roggen
class2.description: A German-style rye beer. Medium-bodied, deep amber in color, with a classically spicy finish.

class2.name: American Graffiti
class2.description:
Big hop aroma from a large dry hop of Equinox after barrel aging in Scotch Barrels. Notes of citrus, tropical fruit, floral and herbal characteristics very dry and light bodied, tart finish.

Yeast: French saison, Brett. Brux., Lacto Delbrueckii, American Ale.

class2.name: English Nut Brown
class2.description: St. George Nut Brown Ale is a classic English-style Brown Ale with flavors reminiscent of biscuit and caramel that is well balanced by a mild hop character. This beer was traditionally served in taverns as their house beer. Our Nut Brown Ale is light brown in color with a thick creamy head.

class2.name: Horizon Red Ale
class2.description: Horizon Red Ale – an emerging American hybrid ale that crosses the boundaries of styles. This red-hued ale projects an intensity of complex hops – yet allows the drinker to experience the balance and character of the malt. Floral, dry, hoppy and satisfying. Beautifully dry hopped, Horizon Red Ale will be considered a classic.

class2.name: #1 Fan
class2.description: 100% orange blossom honey.

class2.name: Nøgne  Saison
class2.description: One of our most refreshing brews, made for those hot summer days, but satisfying year 'round. Recommended serving temperature 8Ã?Â°C/45Ã?Â°F. Goes well with seafood, particularly oysters.

class2.name: Wit
class2.description: It is considered polite in Belgium to stand for a toast. Stand now, and raise a glass to sweet aromas of orange and spice, light-creamy flavor and a refreshing finish. Here’s looking at you, Wit.

class2.name: French Saison
class2.description: Created and brewed as a traditional saison, this beer utilizes a powerful French saison yeast that rips through fermentation, creating a bright effervescent beer. With aromas of light fruit and hops, the flavor moves into a crisp and clean, lightly funky area, finishing with a touch of hop bitterness.

class2.name: Dirty Little Freak
class2.description: Dirty Little Freak Coconut Caramel Chocolate Brown Ale is medium-bodied, 6% abv and a feast for the senses from its dominant blend of warm roasted malt, coconut, caramel, and chocolate flavors and aromas, barely restrained by a gentle hop bite, to a tantalizingly satisfying finish.

class2.name: Victorville Red
class2.description: Bold caramel flavors balanced by copious late kettle additions of citrusy American hops.

class2.name: Bully! Porter
class2.description: The intense flavors of dark-roasted malt in Boulevard’s rendition of the classic English porter are perfectly balanced by a generous and complex hop character. Bully! Porter’s robust nature makes it the ideal companion to a variety of foods, from seafood to chocolate.

class2.name: Harmonie Dark Lager
class2.description:
This beer is based on the very first comercially brewed beer in the state of Indiana.

The name of the brewer was George Bentel. His house is still standing in New Harmony.  The Harmonist brewer and cooper, George Bentel, was born November 3, 1781 in Iptingen, the same village in the Swabian kingdom of Württemberg where George Rapp was born.  Bentel lived at the northeast corner of Brewery and Grainery streets, where his house remains today, as upright as when Indiana's first brewer marched out to make his beer almost two centuries ago.
The German utopian communalists in New Harmony were Indiana's first significant brewers. Beginning in 1816, the Harmonists eventually brewed enough to sell all the way up to what is now West Virginia and down into lower Illinois. From the historical record, it appears the Harmonists brewed a porter-like dark beer. It must have been pretty good beer: An educated German, Ferdinand Ernst, stopped in New Harmony during his journey through the frontier region. “They served me a stein of beer,” Ernst wrote, “and I was not a little astonished to find here a genuine, real Bamberg beer.” He gushed that the Harmonists “must be happiest people of entire Christiandom.” A Louisville agent for the Harmonists reported, “Mr. Breeden, the most celebrated porter seller in the place says the strongest part of it would almost pass for porter and is the best beer he has ever seen in this country…

class2.name: Ha-Czech
class2.description: A well-balanced pilsner with a corn-like malt sweetness and complex spicy hop presence. Moderately bitter, without being aggressive, from the use of Saaz hops. Brewed with traditional ingredients to be as authentic as possible. Named after the legendary Dominik Hasek (The Dominator), Czech Republic born goaltender for the Buffalo Sabres and Detroit Red Wings. Show Less

class2.name: RYE FACTOR RED
class2.description: A deep copper colored ale w/ medium body & bitterness, subtle smoked flavors from the use of cherrywood smoked malt

class2.name: Piercing Pils
class2.description: A Perry-Pils hybrid, Piercing Pils is a Czech Style Pilsner brewed with a White Pear Tea and Pear juice.  Both the juice and the tea were added in the kettle during the whirlpool (after the boil) for maximum flavor and aroma contribution.  The Pear fruit complexity pierces right through the spicy Czech Saaz hops beautifully, adding a gentle acidity to this pale lager that makes for a crisp refreshing sipper.  Amarillo hops add nuanced citrus notes that meld perfectly with the fruit.

class2.name: Winter Ale
class2.description: Brewed for the holidays AND beyond! This beer is lightly spiced and warming, which will keep you cozy all winter.

class2.name: The Big Fella
class2.description: A West Coast spin on a traditional Irish Red Ale, named after Founding Father of the Irish Freedom Movement, Michael Collins. “The Big Fella” balances mellow caramel sweetness with a distinctly West-Coast American hoppiness in this full-bodied copper red ale.

class2.name: Split Rock Creek Pale Ale
class2.description:
Split Rock Creak Pale Ale is our interpretation of an American Pale Ale.

Our brew is named after the cold creek that Judge Brookings fell into on that fateful night. Wooden Legs Brewing company created Split Rock Creek Pale Ale as a refreshing, yet hoppy brew that leads our Flagship fleet. 

We start with 2-Row American malt and add a few touches of caramel malt to balance out the flavor. The malts bring a great pale golden color with great white head. 

Not to be forgotten, the hops come out strong in the flavor of the classic American Cascades with hints of floral, a touch of spice and a dash of citrus. Late in the boil we add the brewer favorite Amarillo hops to give Split Rock Creek that little extra punch of citrus. 

We use a classic American ale yeast that ferments dry, smooth and clean for that well balanced taste.

class2.name: Pilsner
class2.description: Czech out Redhook’s newest brew.  Redhook Pilsner is crisp, golden lager that is modeled after those historic beers originally made in Plzeň, Czechoslovakia.  Redhook Pilsner’s maltiness is offset by a medium dose of Saaz hops and finishes with a clean, bright, thirst-quenching quality. A great “session” lager for when you’ve got a long day ahead of drinking.

class2.name: Old River Stout
class2.description: An American style stout with a moderate hop bitterness and a surprisingly medium-light body. We start by using caramel and roasted barley malts and mash at a lower temperature that is common for this style. We then use American hops to balance the bitterness to make a unique flavored dark beer.

class2.name: Rootstock
class2.description: A single hop rye pale ale. German Polaris hops impart pine, cantaloupe, and mint notes. Perfect for Spring drinking. Cheers!

class2.name: RYE FACTOR RED
class2.description: A deep copper colored ale w/ medium body & bitterness, subtle smoked flavors from the use of cherrywood smoked malt

class2.name: Desperados Red
class2.description: Red is the beer that lifts you up to keep you in the mood for partying, an energetic combination of beer, tequila and guarana.

class2.name: Arjuna
class2.description: Bright. Compelling. Enigmatic. Fruity notes of orange peel, coriander, and chamomile make for a refreshing experience.

class2.name: Evil Eye
class2.description: Amber in color but a style of its own

class2.name: Life Beyond Death
class2.description: Leaving behind a legacy is a desire that lives within us. Some beers want the same. Our black saison is brewed with peppercorns and dried currants creating an intense dark malt presence. The layers of flavor will linger beyond the last sip.

class2.name: Pinedrops
class2.description: This West Coast IPA is like that sweet little Nordic trail off the main trail of Meissner - it takes the high road. Using Pilsner base malt, it is light on malt but not hops. With a hop bill consisting of Amarillo, Centennial, Northern Brewer, and experimental hop X, we packed in the pine along with the citrus notes we love.

class2.name: Mosaic IPA
class2.description:
This is not your average IPA.  From the incredible nose, to the amazing finish, this IPA is one that both session drinkers and beer nerds alike will love.
﻿
We’re full on board the hopwagon with this big American-style IPA.  However, it is not designed to blow your head off with overpowering hop bitterness.  Instead, Mosaic IPA is an extremely well-balanced brew that showcases its unique hop aroma and flavor.
​
This beer gets its name from a new hop variety named “Mosaic,” which is predominantly where the immense, raw hop aroma and flavor is derived.  Mosaic IPA has a noticeable malt backbone to help soften the high level of hop bitterness and flavor, while keeping the body fairly light.
﻿
The word "Mosaic" is also representative of the diverse range of individuals that make up our community.  It's perfect in every way!

class2.name: Space Train
class2.description: They legally wouldn't let us open a brewery unless we brewed an IPA. Five varieties of American hops give this session-ish IPA a fruity aroma and balanced bitterness.

class2.name: Lord Rear Admiral
class2.description: Three Floyds version of an ESB, this deep amber ale has a complex malt sweetness and pronounced apricot hoppiness. Named after Admiral Lord Horatio Nelson.

class2.name: Qualifier IPA
class2.description: Qualifier IPA is a a well balanced IPA with hints of pine and citrus

class2.name: Pomegranate Planet
class2.description: Pomegranate Planet – Our Spring seasonal American Wheat beer infused with the distinctive flavor of real pomegranate!

class2.name: Sunset Red Ale
class2.description: A medium-bodied ale with the perfect balance between malt and domestic hop flavors and aromas. The use of “crystal malt” in the brewing process imparts a rich caramel flavor. The pitching of American ale yeast to this classic style gives our Sunset Red Ale a light fruitiness.

class2.name: Kai
class2.description: Brewed with Grapefruit and Ginger this refreshing summer ale is sure to please and pair at any summer party be it Bar-B-Que or a fine gathering of friends.

class2.name: Boca Blonde
class2.description:
Our flagship beer and best-seller, Boca Blonde is a traditional German Munich Helles Lager. Crisp, clean and highly drinkable with low bitterness and smooth malt flavor. 

Gold Medal, Best Florida Beer Championships 2013 (unfiltered “Zwickl” variant)
Silver Medal, Great American Beer Festival 2000

class2.name: Blood Orange Wheat Ale
class2.description: New to our Pub Series, this beer is brewed with 2-row Northwest Pale, Malted Wheat, and Unmalted Wheat. Blood orange provides a subtle twist to this refreshing brew. It pours with a white lacy head and a hint of orange aroma. A medium malt body with a crisp wheat finish and subtle orange flavor. Blood Orange Wheat Ale is available in six packs, on draft and in our Full Sail Trophy Case variety 12-pack from April to August.

class2.name: 13 Rebels ESB
class2.description: French Broad Brewery’s interpretation of the classic UK Extra Special Bitter. A bright copper color with a complex malt palate is complemented by traditional British hops, notably East Kent Golding. French Broad has made this traditional public house session beer a cult favorite with its skull and crossbones artwork.

class2.name: Nut Hugger
class2.description: Get it on and bust a nut! Caramel and nuts on the nose. Earthy toasted malt with sticky, creamy lacing…a tell-tale climax body with an abundance of nuthuggery. Not too heavy. Not too roasty. Nuttiness rating: amazing drinkability.

class2.name: Restoration Pale Ale
class2.description: Abita Restoration Pale Ale was created after the back-to-back hurricanes devastated Louisiana. With your help, the abita Brewing Company raised over $500,000 for hurricane relief. This brilliant, golden pale ale has a rich body, mild bitterness and a snappy, fresh citrus hop flavor and aroma. Cold filtered and brewed in small batches using no additives or preservatives, the Abita Company is proud to be Louisiana True.

class2.name: Kanzu
class2.description: Farmhouse Ale with Coffee.

class2.name: Berkeley Hundred
class2.description: Scotch Ale fermented with fresh cranberries. This beer is the perfect compliment to the gorgeous fall weather we're currently experiencing: full bodied, slightly sweet and a bit tart. Berkeley Hundred is named for the estate in Virginia where the first Thanksgiving was held almost 400 years ago.

class2.name: Kapai
class2.description:
Back in the day, our US supply of APA hops went up in smoke, literally. So rather than inciting a riot, we turned to some home grown cones as a temporary fix. The result? The evolution of a new style, an Aotearoa Pale Ale to rival its American counterpart. With citrus flavours and full hop finish, the result was Kapai – which means, it’s all good.

Embracing the 100% kiwiness of our Aotearoa Pale Ale, we have recently renamed this brew as kAPAi, encapsulating the true character of the beer.

class2.name: Rip City Red
class2.description: For people who love IPAs but like a little more malt sweetness. We use American 2-row, Munich, Carapils, Crystal-15 and Crystal-120, and a little chocolate malt to add some oomph. We then throw in Palisade, Amarillo, and Centennial hops for a balanced, drinkable beer.

class2.name: Jolly Folly IPA
class2.description: Boldly hoppy, just like the award-winning craft beers the brewery is renowned for, the seasonal offering was created when a newer team member committed a ‘folly’ by mistakenly mixing two different beer tanks, resulting in 500 barrels (or 15,500 gallons!) of the merry new brew. A taste of the resulting batch revealed it to be delicious, a hop bomb with a winter spice flavor. It’s Green Flash’s unexpected gift to IPA enthusiasts this holiday season. Jolly Folly is dominated by resinous, spicy hops. Its piney, floral aroma yields to a full malty flavor that is nicely balanced by multiple layers of citrus and tropical hop flavors.

class2.name: Dikke Lul 3 Bier
class2.description: 1-2-3 en tot de 4. Het maakt niet uit, dikke lul drie bier! If you are not from the Netherlands please do not translate the name of this beer! (Obviously you are going to now!) However this extraordinary hoppy pale ale was named after a Dutch and even Haarlem’ saying (found out after we made the beer). Awesome hop forward and dry-ridiculously-hopped American Pale Ale. Light/medium bodied and a lot of dank hops in it. The good stuff ☺

class2.name: Imperial Dortmunder
class2.description: An imperial golden lager balanced between malt sweetness and dry hop flavors, yet darker in color and richer in finish. Brewed specially in 2008 to celebrate GLBC's 20th Anniversary.

class2.name: Liquid Chords
class2.description: Brown ale with vanilla and cacao nibs and Vanilla Beans.

class2.name: Superstitious Stout
class2.description: This dry Irish stout pours with a creamy "Guinness" style head. Bitter and roast notes peak through this light bodied beer, making it a highly drinkable stout.

class2.name: Papa Noel's Olde Ale
class2.description: This holiday ale was brewed in the English 'old ale' style, a traditional strong ale style that is sometimes called a 'winter warmer.' The warmth comes from the alcoholic strength of the beer, which weighs in at about 7.2% by volume. It is an attractive dark copper-brown hue and is extremely full-bodied. Papa Noel's has a pleasing sweetness from its higher-than-normal alcoholic content, and from its complex malt foundation.This sweetness is balanced by a hint of roasted flavor, as well as a mellow bitterness imparted by a generous amount of English Fuggle hops. Other flavors in evidence are bittersweet chocolate, caramel, and toffee. Papa Noel's Olde Ale is the perfect brew to warm the body and nourish the soul during the cold and wet holiday season. Cheers!

class2.name: Tallboy Hop Harvest Brown Ale
class2.description: A strong Brown Ale brewed with freshly picked whole Cluster hops and wildflower honey.  The result is a beer bursting with malt flavor and resiny hop goodness.  This is a collaborative brew between the brewmasters of Market Garden Brewery, Rocky River Brewery, and Indigo Imp and will be featured at all Cleveland Beer Week events.

class2.name: Holy City Pilsner
class2.description:
The first flagship beer in the Holy City arsenal is our version of a traditional Bohemian-style Pilsner, with significantly amped-up hops, imparting a wonderfully sharp bite to what’s already a dry, crisp affair. This beer will quench your thirst and please your palate all in one glass…but we bet you’ll want a second.

Malts: Bohemian Pilsner & Carahell. Hops: German Magnum & Hallertau Mittelfruh

class2.name: Above the Clouds
class2.description: Style Farmhouse Pale Ale Grain Bill Pilsen, Pale, White Wheat, Crystal 20 Hops Galaxy, Topaz, & Amarillo hops Flavor Profile Bright and easy drinking with a citrus hop character that balances with the fruity esters of the Belgian saison yeast and finishes with a subtle hop bitterness.

class2.name: Old World Hefeweizen
class2.description: Our German-style hefeweizen is an unfiltered wheat beer that is handcrafted using only pure imported Hallertauer German hops grown in the Hallertau region of Germany to give it an original old world taste!  With its white moussy long lasting head, golden color, subtle aroma of bananas, and light hoppy taste, our hefe gives a crisp refreshing taste with a nice balanced finish to make this a perfect everyday beer for everyone to enjoy!

class2.name: Vanilla Bean Buffalo Sweat
class2.description: Vanilla Bean Buffalo Sweat is a combination of our award-winning oatmeal cream stout, Buffalo Sweat, with whole Ugandan vanilla beans. The result is the natural espresso-chocolate flavors of Buffalo Sweat infused with the sweetness of vanilla. It’s an exceptional treat on a cold winter’s night.

class2.name: Gypsy
class2.description: Camomile Wheat

class2.name: Pernicious
class2.description: We start with out flagship Pisgah Pale the age it in oak barrels for a wicked long time, allowing a special strain of wild yeast convert residual sugars into an amazing subtle sourness. Champagne-like effervescence carries the aroma of pressed grapes as flavors yield to a bright hoppy finish. Enjoy!

class2.name: Spelt It, Dealt It
class2.description: A farmhouse ale brewed with 50% spelt wheat and Czech Saaz hops!

class2.name: Smoked Porter
class2.description: A porter-style beer brewed with an addition of German smoked malt. Medium bodied with a hint of smoke on the finish, this beer pairs great with bbq and meat dishes.

class2.name: Newman's Bitter
class2.description: English Extra Special Bitter. Caramel sweetness balanced with Cluster and East Kent Golding hops. Very Smooth with a copper color.

class2.name: Witte Vrouwen
class2.description: Highly refreshing beer based on white beer and weizen. Soft full cream taste and sweet creamy finish. Enjoy this unique taste combination of white and weizen.

class2.name: Gluten-Free IPA
class2.description: Heavily hopped sorghum ale. Grapefruit and citrus mingle with a lingering bitterness. One of our most requested, for gluten-free folks and not!

class2.name: El Despierto Coffee Porter
class2.description:
In Early 2015, Busted Sandal Brewing decided to work on a project to develop a coffee porter that was unlike other coffee porters. Something with substance, where the craft of coffee brewing and the craft of beer brewing were perfectly matched into one delicious drink. After some research, we sought out and established a partnership with The Brown Coffee Company, in San Antonio, Texas.

We quickly learned from Founder and “Coffee Hunter” Aaron Blanco that Brown is not just special, it is unique in its market. You see, Aaron sources his coffee beans for his craft roasting by establishing direct relationships with coffee farmers around the world. He travels to farms and stays with farmers, and regularly hosts them in San Antonio. He seeks out the best of the best coffees, understanding the unique environment and character of each coffee variety where it is grown, as well as which processing methods best suit which coffees, all in pursuit of the perfect cup.

While Brown works diligently to be as transparent and “invisible” as possible in selecting, roasting and serving their coffees, when it comes to our El Despierto Coffee Porter, it is anything but invisible. The coffee in El Despierto comes from the Madan Estate in the Western Highlands of Papua New Guinea. It is a huge coffee with a deep, spicy, tobacco leaf sweetness that converges perfectly with our beer to create something special. Unique. El Despierto is an amazing beer with amazing ingredients that we are sure you will love.

class2.name: Hoppenbier
class2.description:
Jopen Hoppenbier (hops beer) is the only triple-grain double-hopped beer in the world. A crisp beer with a malty foretaste and a lingering, bitter finish.
This golden beer is a precise reproduction of a Haarlem beer and is brewed according to the brewer’s statute (recipe regulated by the council) of 1501. An absolute classic.

class2.name: Calvert Cream Ale
class2.description:
Calvert's Cream Ale was originally brewed as a limited release, but was added to the year-round offerings after it's home-run success at the Calvert Brewing Beer Garden. This American cream ale utilizes corn and rice in the grain bill with an infusion of lemon and orange peel in the boil to create a perfectly refreshing, flavorful, light beer.

5% ABV | 20 IBUs
Color: Pale Gold
Aroma/Tasting Notes: Citrus, Water Cracker
Hops: Motueka, Cluster, Brewer's Gold
Perfect for: Cooling off and relaxing outside
Pairs with: Salads, Fruit, Mild Fish, Lemon Desserts

class2.name: Scratch #46 Naked Elf (2011)
class2.description:
Naked Elf is an exercise in deconstruction and minimalism. This ale has distinct roots in The Mad Elf minus some key components.

The cherries? Gone. 
The honey? Gone. 
The chocolate malt? Gone.

Coming in just under 8% ABV, Naked Elf is an unfiltered golden beauty that displays a pronounced yeast flavor that made The Mad Elf famous as well as a touch of alcohol and some mellow malt flavors.

O.G.: 22 
Malt: Pils, Munich, Crystal 
Yeast: Belgian 
Hops: German Northern Brewers, Czech Saaz

class2.name: Shaughnessy Stout
class2.description: An opaque black, full bodied Irish ale. Roasted coffee aroma, chocolate notes, dry finish

class2.name: Buzzcut Nut Brown Ale
class2.description: Brown ale brewed with honey and hazelnuts.

class2.name: Hop Circle IPA
class2.description: Hoptimization capacitors activated. Taste probe functions optimal. Aroma sensors in overdrive. Engage. Let this otherworldly IPA abduct the hell out of your senses. The gravitational pull of Hop Circle will have you searching the galaxy for another close encounter of the thirst kind. Resistance is futile.

class2.name: DAMPF LOC - Neue Welt Hefe Gerste
class2.description:
Dampf Loc is an all-barley warm fermented ale brewed by the folks from Chicago’s Local Option; inspired by “Dampfbier” originally crafted by medieval peasant inhabitants of the Bavarian Forest.  During the fermentation process generous amounts of foam and surface bubbles burst in the tank, giving the illusion that the ferment is boiling or “steaming.”  Local Option took up the task of brewing Dampf Loc as a modern interpretation of its Teutonic predecessor, creating a “Hefe Gerste” ale that is true to its roots; unmistakable in character yet accessible to beer drinkers of all palates.

Dampf Loc has a mild hop profile, medium body with pleasant effervescence and a clear, rich, orange hue.  Dampf Loc is ideal for warm months, yet enjoyable year round.

class2.name: Redoubt Red Ale
class2.description:
Redoubt Bay, south of Sitka, is a favorite fishing spot for Sockeye Salmon. Also called Red Salmon, this famous species turns bright red and green before spawning in the summer.

Our red, also a local favorite, gets its rich color from roasted barley. A blend of four hops gives it big flavor and aroma.

class2.name: Hopitoulas
class2.description: West Coast style India Pale Ale that combines 6 malts and 6 hops with additional dry hopping for three weeks. It takes about a month and a half to make each batch and we think it is worth the wait. Hints of pine and citrus with a powerful, yet balanced hoppy flavor, Hopitoulas packs a punch that you won’t forget.

class2.name: Alpine Black IPA
class2.description: A robust and deeply textured dark ale. Brewed with midnight wheat, and a blend of Magnum, Cascade, and Amarillo hops. Dry hopped and cold conditioned.

class2.name: Hoppelganger IPA
class2.description: R&B’s Hoppelganger IPA is a Northwest style India Pale Ale, created for the true beer connoisseur. An assertive blend of Crystal, Columbus, Chinook, Mt. Hood, and Cascade Hops, is added to premium English, French-Belgian, and Canadian malts to create a fresh floral aroma and generous malt flavour, so emblematic of true Northwest-style I.P.A.s. Hoppelganger’s clean and slightly sweet finish is followed by an aggressive hop bitterness. At 45 IBU’s, this beer is definitely…NOT FOR THE FAINT OF TONGUE!!!

class2.name: Free Beer
class2.description:
What if quality could be cheap? What if high content beer could be cheaper than low content beer? Would this affect choice?
This reflection sparked the second collaboration of Evil Twin Brewing & Omnipollo. An IPA brewed using an abundance of Australian and New Zeeland hops laid on a fluffy bed of English, Belgian and German malts.
The twist — to remove the money aspect of choosing craft beer we decided to bring in a sponsor.
Batch #1 is generously sponsored by The Bishop’s Arms, specialty beer bar and pioneers of the Swedish craft beer scene.

class2.name: Treeman ESB
class2.description: Classic malty English style ale.

class2.name: Sieban Larger
class2.description: A full bodied, malt-accentuated amber lager, best described as Biergarten Marzen. Double decocted from German Pilsner, Vienna and Munich malts with several kettle additions of Nobel hops. We have re-worked this family favorite many times over the years and of the 20 or so recipes created it was "number seven or Sieben” in German that was selected by our diverse tasting panel as the best of the best.

class2.name: Java Porter
class2.description:
A medium-bodied ale with robust coffee aroma and flavor from the addition of coffee beans into the boil.

Local coffee roaster Partridge & Quigley’s Sumatran Blue Ling Tong coffee beans

class2.name: Milk Stout
class2.description: Dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted malt aromas and flavors characterize this Stout providing silky, smooth warmth for the winter season. This Milk Stout is the result of the Collaborator project, a project between the Oregon Brew Crew (one of the oldest home brewing clubs in the nation) and Widmer Brothers that identifies unique beer styles for distribution to the public.

class2.name: Twisted X
class2.description: This Premium lager has a subtle hop flavor and a crisp clean finish. Yellow corn from Richardson Farms adds a touch of that Mexican lager flavor. At 5.1% alcohol by volume it is our lightest beer, however, lighter does not equate to lack of flavor.

class2.name: Atom Splitter
class2.description: A cross between a red ale and an IPA, this beer is hopped high with Amarillo and Citra hops. The mixture of the hops creates a floral bouquet of delectable citrus with an approachable bitterness.

class2.name: Luminous - Excelsior! Series
class2.description: Brewed with wheat and aged NYS hops.  Fermented for over a year, this ale is a delightful meditation on uninhibited life; a celebration of esoteric flavors.  Enjoy the simple, yet intriguing pineapple, cherry, mango, and hay aroma complemented by a bucolic funk. All cushioned by a dazzling effervescence and a light tartness, a truly wild ale reminiscent of the pastoral landscapes surrounding the Finger Lakes.

class2.name: Marzën
class2.description: German Spring Lager aged to perfection brewed with 2 Row Barley, Crystal, Victory and Munich Malts. Has an amber complexion with caramel and roasted characteristics and a fairly dry finish. This higher gravity lager is named after the month of March when most brewers made this beer.

class2.name: Saison de l’Evolution
class2.description: Hazy Belgian-style farmhouse ale that draws spice and crispness from rye and hops, and is rounded out with candied ginger, coriander, and citrus.  Fruity sweetness lands on the tongue first, followed by spice and a subtle hoppiness that can’t help but tas

class2.name: Bock
class2.description: Opening with a rich, crusty bread, this beer brings nutiness, caramel sweetness and ripe pit fruits. A  medium full-bodied beer with a long lasting malty finish.

class2.name: Mosh Pit
class2.description: Hoppy Red Ale.

class2.name: Hefeweizen
class2.description: A lightly hopped, refreshing, Bavarian style wheat ale that has hints of banana and clove in the finish. Typically available May until October.

class2.name: CASK CONDITIONED BEHIND ABBEY DOORS WITH RASPBERRIES
class2.description: Brewmaster Brian took our Belgian Brown Ale, Behind Abbey Doors, and put it in a firkin with a bunch of fresh red raspberries. Traditionally served using gravity, this cask conditioned ale is a smooth, rare treat.

class2.name: Kuld Filtreerimata
class2.description:
Tõelistele õllegurmaanidele on Saku Kullal pakkuda isemoodi säravaim pruul - filtreerimata Saku Kuld. See on hägune nauditav kvaliteetõlu, mis lausa pakatab maitsest.

Note: Silver label.

class2.name: Frankenlager
class2.description:
In Mary Shelley’s novel, a modern-day Prometheus combines disparate parts to create something uncontrollable, destructive and misunderstood. Lucky for you (and our team) that brewing is much more predictable and manageable, especially in our new state-of-the-art brewery in Hampton, NH.
The India-style Pale Lager is a new hybrid-style of beer that’s begun surfacing throughout the craft brewing nations of the world. Frankenlager is Smuttynose’s presentation of a double IPA mashed and fermented like the classic lagers of Europe. Crisp and refined, but certainly not meek or mild, Frankenlager is one the first beers brewed in our new home and we’re excited to present it to the world.

class2.name: Standing Stones
class2.description: A very malty scotch ale with a slight smokiness.

class2.name: Hefeweizen
class2.description: There is no Oktoberfest without Hefeweizen. Brewed with classic German ingredients, our take on this style is loaded with banana esters and hints of clove producing a flavorful and highly drinkable wheat beer.

class2.name: Superpest Double IPA
class2.description:
BRONZE MEDAL WINNER - IMPERIAL IPAS -  BC BEER AWARDS 2014!

"Lead by example" is no forced cliche to the Superpest - it's an innate ethic.  In the bottle, that directive is deftly delivered by the great Centennial, Chinnok, and Columbus hops of the Pacific Northwest.  Only BC-malted 2-row barley is good enough to echo the Superpest name, so that's what we use...

class2.name: Hoppy Boy
class2.description: Hoppy Boy India Pale Ale is the flagship beer of Twisted Pine. It pours a hazy pale orange and has a dry, tart taste with an earthy bitterness.   Pleasant grapefruit and citrus notes are provided by the addition of Cascade hops.  This classic American IPA is brewed with medium caramel malts that play off the citrus and orange rind hop flavors to make this beer most enjoyable.

class2.name: Crows Foot
class2.description: As many sailors were barefoot, pirates would toss this multi pronged steel weapon on to the deck of the ship they were attacking, causing chaos. Hints of roasted barley, coffee, chocolate and acidic funk pierce your palate in this light bodied, dry, black ale.

class2.name: Oktoberfest
class2.description: Lager

class2.name: Colchuck
class2.description: Fresh, satisfying, easy drinking, medium bodied golden ale, moderate wheat flavor light hop character, malty sweetness.

class2.name: Carpe Noctem
class2.description:
Many of history’s most important revolutions began at night, and this beer is brewed to salute those that “Seize the Night” and make it one for the history books! 

CARPE NOCTEM is a black-as-night oatmeal coffee stout with roasted grain aroma and bold coffee character from coffee beans from East Sac’s famous “Chocolate Fish Coffee Roasters.” 

Chocolate and carafa malts present a slight sweetness and mild roastiness with earthy, nutty tones together with a creamy body from locally grown oatmeal. 

So pour yourself a glass of this bad boy and start your own revolution tonight!

class2.name: Sapporo Premium
class2.description: With lush use of aroma hops, Sapporo Premium has an amazingly crisp taste, refreshing flavor, and refined bitterness to leave a clean finish. Whether in our iconic SILVER CAN that is long loved by our American fans, in bottles, or on tap, Sapporo Premium Beer can be enjoyed on any occasion.

class2.name: Black Noddy
class2.description: This is a traditional Bavarian Schwarzbier style with a deep color and a smooth rich flavor. Specially roasted malts give the black color and mild roastiness to this beer while Munich, Caramel, and Honey malts add depth and character to the malt flavor. Moderately hopped with noble aroma varieties to achieve a perfect balance and a clean finish this beer is a perfect complement to smoked, grilled, and roasted foods, flavorful meats and cheeses or chocolate desserts.

class2.name: Best Brown Ale
class2.description: Rich brown ale perfect for the fall and winter. Plenty of malt character and smooth sweet finish give this brown ale its distinct character.

class2.name: Jan
class2.description: Bavaria, Floral, Mandarin, Bi-Lingual.

class2.name: 6th Generation Stock Ale
class2.description: Stock ales were once common among America’s family run breweries. 6th Generation Stock Ale features a unique blend of  malts and  the finest  hops from the Pacific Northwest.  Then we finish  in the hopjack for the signature hop flavor. 44 IBUs and our special milling and endosperm mashing process make for a smooth and refreshing ale.

class2.name: Lighthouse
class2.description:
The Pensacola Lighthouse is an icon for our hometown, and so is our Porter. For centuries, a light high above a tower has served as a beacon to sailors at sea. Even though we don’t keep the Lighthouse Porter on our roof, you’d be surprised at how many sailors seem to think it’s a sign!

The Gulf’s shallow waters can be treacherous. Without the Pensacola Lighthouse, who knows how many ships would have succumbed to a dark and foggy night? Find your way out of the dreary rat race and relax with the Lighthouse Porter

The Lighthouse Porter is flavorful, without being heavy. An enjoyable sipping beer, you’ll definitely find your way to shore with our Lighthouse Porter.

class2.name: Hopped Up Red Ale
class2.description: This amber ale is medium-bodied with low bitterness and has a nice hop punch. Brewed with organic malts.

class2.name: Bronx Autumn PA
class2.description:
Fresh juice pressed from New York State apples makes up a quarter of the fermentables of this crips and easy-drinking Autumn Pale Ale, lending it a slightly acidic, fruity and tannic finish.  Northern Brewer hops from the west coast are added to the kettle and conditioning tank, contributing a woody and subtle mint character.  

Malt bill:  Briess Pilsen Malt, Briess Special Roast
Hop bill:  Northern Brewer
Apple varieties:  Idared, Crispin, Gala, Stayman-Winesap, Macintosh from Soons Orchard, NY

class2.name: Polyjuice Potion
class2.description: This collaborative ale is for wizards & muggles who solemnly swear they are up to no good. A sour brew concocted with plums, elderberries, and magical bits and bobbles.

class2.name: Amber
class2.description: Loaded with caramel flavors, fruity esters and a hint of toasted malts. Full enough for those snappy spring days, while finishing with a clean bitterness that refreshes on the warm ones.

class2.name: Aglianico Kolsch
class2.description: Aglianico is a red wine grape thought to be one of the oldest varietals and brought to Italy by the ancient Greeks. Cultivated in the small quantities by the Orsi Family in Dry Creek, this spicy and tannic fruit blends well with our soft Global Kolsch.

class2.name: Fire House Pale Ale
class2.description: Firehouse Pale Ale was inspired by the 1914 Cortland Firehouse which is located across the road from the brewery. The beer pours a gold color with a frothy white head with a noticable Cascade hop aroma. The taste is smooth and slightly malty, with just enough hop flavors to make it light and clean. A great everyday drinking Pale Ale.

class2.name: Georgetown Braggot
class2.description: Our version of this less-than-famous style of mead is technically a bottle-conditioned ale using local blackberry honey. We add Northern Brewer hops and ferment it with a Belgian yeast strain. The malt bill includes Munich, Pilsner and Special B malts.

class2.name: Peachicot Blonde Ale
class2.description: River Company’s Peachicot Blonde Ale is a light and fruity blonde ale brewed with a 2 Row Brewers Malt, Dextrine malt, a hint of corn, and peach and apricot flavors. Light and refreshing without being overly sweet, it is the perfect summer day beer. We called it Peachicot because Aprieach sounded stupid!

class2.name: Tipsy Hipster
class2.description: A showcase of our favorite dank, resin-y hops including Apollo, Columbus & Simcoe with a citrus punch provided by Centennial & Amarillo, Clandestine's 'Tipsy Hipster' is not brewed to be the strongest or most bitter IPA, instead we offer the hop-head a completely unbalanced hop-forward beer. Brewed with a base of Maris Otter, Tipsy Hipster has just enough malt to provide a backbone to the waves of hop flavors produced by multiple kettle additions, a hop-stand, and multiple dry-hop additions. These abundant hop additions result in huge citrus and dank pine flavors and aromas that will last to the bottom of your glass. Remember- this beer is best enjoyed fresh!

class2.name: Battle Point Stout
class2.description:
THE BEER: A big, bold, dark, American Stout. Battle Point maintains a complex roastiness, with hints of caramel and chocolate, without being overly burnt or bitter. Smooth as silk and dark as night. ESB, Flaked Barley, Crystal 40, Chocolate malt, Black malt, Black barley, Carafa III, and just a hint of Extra Special malt. Hops are Nugget, Apollo and Willamette.

THE STORY: Located on the West side of the Island, Battle Point was supposedly named for a battle between a raiding northern tribe and the local Suquamish, in which Chief Kitsap and his men were victorious. During World War II, a radio post was established there as part of a network for intercepting and decoding Japanese radio transmissions. Now it's a park, and when I was a kid we used to shoot off model rockets there. Battle Point Stout is named after this historical corner of the island.

class2.name: Treacherous
class2.description: Cranberry Apple Cider.

class2.name: Ramstein Blonde
class2.description: Unfiltered traditional German weiss beer. Malty wheat bouquet brimming with clove and apple aromas. Wheat and barley balanced by imported German Tettnanger hops. The finish is smooth and refreshing.

class2.name: Old Baldy
class2.description: Old Baldy is an Experimental Belgian Golden Ale with a hazy yellow glow and aromatic complexities of fruity bubblegum, spice, and banana taffy.  A snappy ginger bite complement the fresh citrus flavors of tangerine. The beer also has a wonderful cleansing effervescence.  The finish contains a notable bitterness that’s slightly peppery and dry.

class2.name: Dragons Milk Brown Ale
class2.description: Dry-hopped brown ale, very aromatic, tastes of roasted chocolate and coffee with a full-bodied finish.

class2.name: Amber Ale
class2.description:
A medium bodied copper-colored ale that shows notable caramel malt flavor with moderate hop bitterness along with a hint of fruit.

Brain of Brewers 2010 Bronze Medal.

class2.name: Ryes Up Rye Saison
class2.description: A light and crisp Farmhouse Ale with hints of spice. Hints of clove and banana esters pair perfectly with the spicey rye. One of our lighter Saisons but one of our favorites.

class2.name: Stir Crazy
class2.description: A new season means new adventures. We created Stir Crazy Winter Ale to warm you from within during the coldest time of year. Our sturdy winter warmer is brewed with cocoa nibs, vanilla, raisins and brown sugar. Layers of malty goodness create a dark ruby color and satisfying notes of chocolate and rich caramel, while pulverized raisins and brown sugar provide a fruity complexity. Bundle up and enjoy!

class2.name: Holiday Toffee Ale
class2.description: An Amber Belgian Ale hopped with Cluster and Santiam cheer. Rich malt body comprised of Canadian Honey malt and English Marris Otter malt. We let this seasonal beauty simmer with dark Belgian candy sugar and chocolate covered toffees from River Street Sweets in Savannah.

class2.name: Le Chiffre
class2.description: Belgian yeast transforms simple ingredients—pilsen malt, noble hops, and beet sugar—into a fruity, spicy, slightly tart ale with a crisp FINISH despite its relatively high alcohol content. The finishing touch: We serve this one with a big frothy head!

class2.name: Brunch
class2.description: Cider W/Maple & Walnuts

class2.name: Big Oak
class2.description: A Vienna Lager brewed to the strength of a Bock.

class2.name: Sweet Myrtle - Side Trail Series
class2.description: Sweet Myrtle was chosen as the winner of the 15 Beers for 15 Years Competition at Upland Brewing Company’s 15th Anniversary. What began as a brewer’s desire to make a non-traditional ale turned into a crowd favorite. Sweet Myrtle celebrates both an anniversary and the passion we have for making great beer as seen through our Side Trail Series. Cheers!

class2.name: Stoneface Porter
class2.description: Everybody's got their thing. For some, it's campfires, music, unwinding. For others it's about breaking a sweat; a hike, a run, a ride. Some people want an absurdly hoppy IPA while others go for rich dark ales. Some choose all of the above - and that's how we roll. Do your thing; try new things; repeat. And try a Stoneface. We think you'll like that thing, too.

class2.name: Sweet Myrtle - Side Trail Series
class2.description: Sweet Myrtle was chosen as the winner of the 15 Beers for 15 Years Competition at Upland Brewing Company’s 15th Anniversary. What began as a brewer’s desire to make a non-traditional ale turned into a crowd favorite. Sweet Myrtle celebrates both an anniversary and the passion we have for making great beer as seen through our Side Trail Series. Cheers!

class2.name: Stoneface Porter
class2.description: Everybody's got their thing. For some, it's campfires, music, unwinding. For others it's about breaking a sweat; a hike, a run, a ride. Some people want an absurdly hoppy IPA while others go for rich dark ales. Some choose all of the above - and that's how we roll. Do your thing; try new things; repeat. And try a Stoneface. We think you'll like that thing, too.

class2.name: Black Ice
class2.description: A light-bodied, crisp and refreshing American Ale.  Brewed to feature a subtle malt sweetness complimented by mild floral hops.  The combination is a well balanced light-bodied and refreshing ale.  Originally released for the 2016 Black Ice Pond Hockey Tournament in Concord, NH.

class2.name: Antebellum Ale
class2.description: An 1840?s American recipe using water, yeast, molasses, ginger and spruce tips. The ingredients from the historical drink have been adapted into a flavorful modern day beer incorporating malt and hops.

class2.name: 10th Anniversary Ale
class2.description: This pale is highlighted by the spicy hop character of German Tettnang and the piney citrus notes of American Cascade. Light in body with a dry finish

class2.name: Paradisiac
class2.description: (Better a Witty Fool Than) A Foolish Wit with strawberries and kiwis added.

class2.name: Quaker State with Coffee and Vanilla
class2.description: Our regular Quaker State made with French Roast coffee from Katahdin Speciality Coffee in Wells, ME and vanilla.

class2.name: Ginger Hop IPA
class2.description: Hops and ginger combine in this interesting take on an IPA. This beer is hopped with Sarachi Ace hops to provide lemon notes which blend well with the character that the multiple additions of ginger add!

class2.name: Bee Keeper
class2.description: A light, dry, refreshing summer ale. Hints of banana and bread on the nose. A clean finish highlighted by a touch of cloves and subtle honey flavor. Very low in bitterness.

class2.name: Wedding Alt
class2.description: Modeled after the Alt style from Düsseldorf, Wedding Alt is characterized by a clean, balanced flavor that is ushered in by subtle hop aroma. Wedding Alt dances crisply on the palate and finishes with a slight sweetness.

class2.name: Celilo CDA
class2.description: A dark ale hopped with Summit, Chinook and Tomahawk with a malt backbone of Midnight Wheat.

class2.name: Cape May Richie’s Rad Pale Ale
class2.description: ABV: 5.4% SRM 4.4 IBU 58 Dryer than dry with a hop stickiness that coats your mouth, with a lingering grapefruit bitterness that accentuates the dryness leaving you thirsty for more, this Pale Ale defines being rad. Continuing our Employee Series, if you’ve had a conversation with our sales guy Richie you’ll know why we named this Rad - as invariably within minutes he’s referred to something as being "rad." Richie wanted a rad beer that was crushable and bursting at the seams with tropical notes and hoppy dankness, and with spring in full swing you’re reaching for a brew that’ll let you pound back a few rounds. Begging for a couple go-to’s, Richie’s Rad Pale Ale is one you’re going to put back with ease.

class2.name: Witness
class2.description: Witness is a bretted Belgian pale ale drawing inspiration from the Trappist Monasteries. Combining the classic Bastonge yeast (from Orval) and then both Brettanomyces Bruxellensis and Brettanomyces Clausenii to condition this beer will be hoppy and fragrant fresh but will also age gracefully like it's traditional predecessors, building complexity in the bottle.

class2.name: Penalty Kick ESB
class2.description: An American-style ESB, this Extra Special Bitter comes in a ~7% with a great, malty body and a slight rye and hop bite.

class2.name: Spruce Tip India Red Ale
class2.description: An homage to the rugged wild beauty of the West Coast, this aggressively hopped India Red Ale combines smooth malt character with an assertive bitterness. A combination of Simcoe hops and freshly picked, locally sourced Sitka Spruce tips provides a blend of pine, citrus, mint and green flavours. As part of our “Farm to Glass Series” this beer utilizes ingredients grown and harvested right here in the Fraser Valley.

class2.name: Slugfest Wheat
class2.description: With 55% wheat and 9% Vienna Malt, Slugfest is a sweet authentic German Wheat Beer. We used a true German yeast strain which imparts clove and banana esters. O.G. Plato 15.5 (1.062) 5.5% by Wt.

class2.name: Montepulciano Kolsch
class2.description: Indigenous to Italy, and brought to us by the Orsi Family in Dry Creek, Montepulciano is a varietal that has a deep ruby color and produces a juice with a soft flavors reminiscent of plum jam. Blended with a light Kolsch ale and refermented in oak.

class2.name: Nightmare Oatmeal Stout
class2.description: A full-bodied stout with a smooth, not bitter, coffee - like flavor from roasted barley and oats.

class2.name: Saison
class2.description: An award winning homebrew recipe by Bob Hall and our Pro-Am entry to the 2013 GABF.  A Saison brewed with demerara sugar.  Dry, fruity with some spice character.

class2.name: Citrus IPA
class2.description: This IPA has just what you need to get you ready for spring.  It is brewed with with CITRUSY hops: Columbus, Amarillo, Pilgrim, LEMON and ORANGE peel.  Then dry-hopped with more Amarillo for added HOPPY citrus punch.  The aroma is sweet yet the taste is dry with a great ROBUST IPA finish.

class2.name: FAT UNICORN PALE ALE
class2.description: Medium-bodied, balanced pale ale.  Citrus, herbal, minty hop aroma.  Toasty, biscuit malt character.  Smooth mouthfeel.  Clean finished.  Balanced.

class2.name: Nether Regions
class2.description: A blend of a Belgian Wit and a German wheat this is truly a brew from the Nether Regions. Giving off an aroma of pepper and clove with a hint of banana esters that loft up at the end. Flavor lends to the balance of pepper, clove and banana.

class2.name: Silver Bay IPA
class2.description:
Tucked away at the south end of Sitka's road system, you'll find Silver Bay. Abundant marine life and the impressive sheer face of Bear Mountain make it especially photogenic. Soon after the brewery opened, a rough and tumble bunch of girls who work at a fish processing plant on Silver Bay came in for samples and noticed our IPA was not yet named. They recommended Silver Bay IPA then attempted to wipe out our supply.

Also rough and tumble, our IPA is hoppy with plenty of flavor.

class2.name: 847 Suburban Wheat Ale
class2.description: Our most popular brew, our wheat is brewed with approximately 50% wheat malt and 50% malted barley. The flavor of this brew is very well balanced meaning it is neither malty (sweet) or hoppy (bitter) like most of Finn's beers This is great beer to begin with if you haven't had a micro-brewed beer. Mickey Finn's flagship beer.

class2.name: Crimson Ridge Vintage Dry
class2.description: In the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains at Wintergreen, Virginia is a cidery overlooking the Rockfish River.  Here a custom blend of Virginia apples is crafted to make a premium hard cider with a rounded, full-bodied apple taste.  Rich and beautifully effervescent, Crimson Ridge is exceptionally well-balanced, bringing out the very best in Virginia apples.

class2.name: Black IPA
class2.description: Also known as a Cascadian Dark Ale and an American Black Ale, IPA hops with a slight roast flavor and a black coffee color.

class2.name: Pale Ale
class2.description: This classic American Pale Ale is floral to the nose and flavorful to the mouth.  2-Row & 5 Specialty Malts create subtle caramel tones while just the slap right amout of cascade hops make our Pale Ale just a shade short of perfect.  Grab some and tell us what you think.  Surely to be one of your favorites.

class2.name: Saison Vert
class2.description: Saison Vert is an open fermented wheat based brew made with black limes, giving the otherwise bright beer a darker flavor profile. Layered with spice, citrus, earth, and even walnut notes, Saison Vert goes down easily with tremendous nuance. Several kegs will see out of state distribution, so look for both locally and across the country.

class2.name: Heathen
class2.description: An american IPA brewed with a blend of 3 base malts and a multitude of hops.

class2.name: Resolute
class2.description: This obsidian-colored stout pushed the capacity of our mash tun to the limits with its huge grain bill! It looks like a one-pint espresso shot; black, strong, weighty and rich, but perfectly balanced.

class2.name: Sour Citrus Mystress
class2.description: This light and effervescent beer pops with tangy farmhouse character in the nose and continues on with a bright acidic bite on the palate. Citrus-forward American hops accompany the aromatic lemon and orange west added post-fermentation. A mineral quality is prominent throughout the profile with an extra dry finish.

class2.name: Pale Ale
class2.description:
Tap Room No. 21 Pale Ale holds the code to unlocking the mystery of the 1920’s speakeasies. With its balanced flavor, this Pale Ale offers a true taste of American history. No secret handshakes or passwords needed to enjoy this fine ale. Just pop the top and celebrate the repeal of prohibition.

A true Pale Ale. Balanced Cascade, Amarillo and Tomahawk hops create a citrusy aroma with a clean, crisp finish. The hops give way to a light malt flavor producing a traditional reddish amber hue.

class2.name: Ramen to Biiru
class2.description: Made for the Mikkeller Restaurant Ramen to Bíiru, Belgian light ale with Brett.

class2.name: Black Lantern
class2.description: A beer for the brightest of days and the blackest of nights. Black Lantern combines dark roasted malt flavor with bright herbal, earthy pine hop aroma. Its well-balanced and aggressively dry-hopped.

class2.name: Paienne (Pagan)
class2.description: Paienne is a top-fermenting June straw blond coloured beer. It presents aromas of malt, fruits and hops. Its well-balanced flavours are dominated by malty and fresh cereals tastes, completed by a delicate bitterness. All of this makes the Paienne an inviting and thirst-quenching beer offering at the same time satisfying tastes and a generous body.

class2.name: Chai Tea Porter
class2.description:
Chai Tea and Porter have finally hooked up. Why not? 
Seriously bold flavors of Ginger, Cinnamon, Clove, Cardamom, 
Anise combined with a six-malt blend, make this a hands-down discovery in beer. What is a Dhaba anyway? We'll give you a hint, think of India. Available in 6pack Cans and on tap.

class2.name: NazionAle
class2.description: The first beer made from 100% Italian Italian totally raw materials, grown by us, so as to produce this beer intentionally simple, where water, malt, hops and yeast come together in a harmonious and original. A beer that will find admirers and that will push to combinations and combinations more or less daring but today is "primarily" a turning point in the production of Italian craft beer.

class2.name: Buxom Blonde
class2.description: This Belgian Abby style is well proportioned, soft, and beautiful like the name suggests. Nice fruity tones, to compliment this beers body, and healthily hoped and well proportioned.

class2.name: Coconut Hiwa Porter
class2.description: Brewed with a carefully crafted malt bill comprised of seven different varieties of malted barley, this dark ale is sure to please even the most discerning of drinkers.  Look for a silky mouthfeel and notes of roasted malt, dark cacao and coffee. The addition of in-house hand toasted coconut lends a delightful and distinct tropical aroma that carries through into the flavor.  Cascade hops are used to temper the sweetness and lend a spicy yet subdued complexity.

class2.name: Bayerisch Dunkel
class2.description:
Der Körper leuchtet in dunklem kastanienbraun und die feinen Malzaromen schmeicheln dem Geruchssinn 
noch vor dem ersten Schluck und lassen ein großartiges Geschmackserlebnis bereits erahnen.
Das feine Röstaroma sowie der vollmundig weiche Körper kommt beim ersten Schluck herrlich weich

am Gaumen an. 

Dezente Aromen von Birne, gemischt mit dem Geschmack nach Zartbitterschokolade vollenden 

die fein ausbalancierte Mischung aus angenehm bitteren und zart - süßen Noten.
Im Abgang hinterlässt es einen weichen und runden, rezenten Eindruck mit einer

leichten Kaffenote und verwöhnt sie besonders in gemütlichen Stunden.
Diese Spezialität passt sehr gut zu Entenbraten, Schmorbraten, Geselchten sowie zu warmen, süßen Desserts.

class2.name: Hoptree IPA
class2.description: With 11 different hops and a malty foundation, this IPA unleashes bold flavor.  The grassy, tangerine aroma leads into a bright mix of citrus and lemongrass, with a fleeting bitter finish.

class2.name: Saint Dekkera Reserve Sour: Flanders Oud Bruin
class2.description: Our Saint Dekkera® Reserve Sour Ales are naturally soured by spontaneous/wild secondary fermentation and aging in oak barrels with microflora wonderfully unique to our downstate Illinois terroir, where we embrace the individual, wild character of each barrel to produce beers with a wide array of acidity, sourness and unadulterated funkiness.

class2.name: Crosswind Pale Ale
class2.description: Although pale ale is one of the world’s most common beer styles, Crosswind is anything but. Light in color but not flavor, our pale ale is a surefire hit among drinkers of full-flavored premium imports.

This Ale is truly American. It is a West-Coast original. This style of beer was originally developed in San Francisco, where the air was cool enough to substitute for refrigeration. It is an improvisation of a beer developed as early as the Gold Rush days. One sip, and you'll think you've struck gold!

class2.name: 20th Anniversary Experimental IPA
class2.description: This refreshing session ale delivers citrus and pine notes from unique experimental hops. Two decades strong and we taste mighty fresh. Cheers to 20 years of Victory!

class2.name: Schwarzbier
class2.description: German lager built on pilsner base malt and a few specialty malts, made black with Midnight Wheat malt. Hopped with Hallertau and fermented with the Weihenstephan 206 strain.

class2.name: Dorian Stout with Pumpkin
class2.description: Our Dorian Stout base mixed with fresh organic pumpkin and spices.

class2.name: English Brown
class2.description: Nutty and roasty malt flavors set the stage for our English Brown.  English East Kent Goldings Hops are used for both bittering and aroma in this beer, perfectly balancing out the malt forward character.

class2.name: Hoplanta
class2.description: HOPLANTA is an easy drinking American style IPA (India Pale Ale) that is hoppy without being overly bitter. As this beer pours into your favorite glass, you will notice the beautiful honey color topped by a fluffy white head. The aroma is dominated by citrus, with hints of pine and malt sweetness. While drinking, you’ll notice the hop profile of resinous grapefruit balanced by a distinctive malt backbone, highlighting our use of Vienna malt.

class2.name: Warrior
class2.description: Warrior Black Ale is a well-hopped "India black ale." Judicious use of debittered roasted barley give Warrior it's distinctive black hue, while leaving a gentle roast in the finish. Filled with sticky Pacific Northwest hops in the kettle and then dry hopped generously with Columbus, Summit, and Amarillo for a resinous nose. Warrior is a collaborative effort with our good friend Noah Regnery, the award-winning brewer from Pizza Port San Clemente.

class2.name: Rubaeus
class2.description: As promised Founders Brewing Company has created something unlike the rest. Amongst this summers over crowded race to cloudy wheat beers, we have decided to embark down a path all our own. Using only fresh raspberries, rübæus translates into intense flavors combined with a no hesitation malt bill. In fermentation we add fresh raspberries at five separate stages to achieve the ultimate balance between tartness and sweetness.

class2.name: Saison Blue
class2.description: In the spirit of traditional Belgian farmhouse ales, Saison Blue is brewed mostly from malted barley but with sizable contributions from regional ingredients (traditionally wheat, spelt, or buckwheat). In our case, we happen to use blue corn and blue agave nectar. It is then lightly dry-hopped with American and European hops for a bright, herbal and floral finish. To us, it represents a link between old-world brewing traditions and new-world processes and ingredients. At the end of the day, this beer is bone dry, light bodied and quite refreshing, but features a spicy, complex flavor and aroma profile.

class2.name: La Flama Blanca
class2.description: Simply made with two different malts and two different hops, our white is the most delicate beer in the lineup. Notes of citrus and clove can be detected as the ale quietly passes over the palate.

class2.name: Ambassador
class2.description:
The best of both brewing worlds: A hybrid Belgian-American strong pale ale with golden-copper color, medium body and maltiness, low caramel/toasty malt flavor, floral and citrus-like American-variety hops used to produce high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma
but some phenolic spiciness and high fruity esters from Belgian ale yeast.

class2.name: Fatted Calf Sacrificial Stout
class2.description: A seven grain Stout masterpiece on nitro! Rolled oats and soft wheat give our Dry Stout a smoothness that compliments chocolate malts. This Nitrogen infused ale is a Prodigal Son original – enjoy!

class2.name: Harvest Pale Ale
class2.description: A medium bodied, deep golden ale with a distinctive aroma and refreshing flavor. Dry-hopping with Cascade and Centennial hops produces a beer with a delightful balance of natural sweetness and assertive hop finish.

class2.name: Smoked Apple Ale
class2.description: The scents of late fall in a glass! We mix smoked malt, freshly pressed apple juice, and classic apple pie spices to create a beer that will remind you of cold days around the campfire.

class3.name: Kill'em Ale
class3.description:
Our Double or Imperial IPA has intense hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma, and is balanced by a full malty body with a notably evident complex alcohol flavor.

Brewed entirely with CTZ hops (lots of them) and dry-hopped in the fermenter with more CTZ. Kill ‘Em Ale is double dry-hopped with Glacier hops in the serving tank.

class3.name: Dubbel
class3.description: This beer is malt forward, with dark dried fruits - raisins, currants, dried plums dominating the malt profile. The maltiness is balanced against the fruity esters to create a complex beer that gets better with age. This is great for sipping, but also pairs with hearty meats and stews.

class3.name: Blitzkrieg Hops Double IPA
class3.description: With the amount of IPAs brewed here in the States you’d think that there’s only one way to skin a cat. While the West Coast style has long dominated the style, there’s a world of IPAs you should explore, and Blitzkrieg Hops DIPA wouldn’t be a bad start. Blitzkrieg is a big, 9% ABV, juicy, earthy hopped English-style double IPA brewed entirely with English malts, hops, and fermented with an English ale yeast strain. Brewed with Maris Otter pale malt, and hopped with Admiral, Pilgrim, Phoenix, and Target hops; all big, juicy, high alpha English hops that we thought needed a lil’ love, each of which is over 10% alpha acid.  Blitzkrieg Hops DIPA is our homage to the birthplace of the IPA as well as the band that inspired its name.

class3.name: Organized Play Date
class3.description: Utilizing a blend of juicy American hops this IPA lends grapefruit and other tropical notes. Further, conditioning on Pineapples and Limes push this into the "juice bomb" territory.

class3.name: Sacred Hop
class3.description: A well balanced Double IPA, slightly resinous up front with a crisp floral finish.

class3.name: Tripel
class3.description:
This strong golden ale is marked by passion fruit and herbal notes in the aroma, with suggestions of banana and honey in the complex palate. The Tripel has a remarkably long and smooth finish.

Awards - Gold, GABF 2006

class3.name: Danny Greene Enforcer
class3.description: Brewed to celebrate Cleveland’s Irish heritage, but menacing enough that we had to name it after notorious local mobster Danny Greene.  Proceed with caution and exuberance.

class3.name: Tupelo Mead
class3.description: Tupelo is a semi-sweet traditional mead crafted with 100% raw Tupelo honey, water, and yeast.  Regarded as the gold standard of honey around the world, Tupelo honey is gathered for a few brief weeks in the Apalachicola River basin in the panhandle of Florida.  Our Tupelo Mead is handcrafted to showcase this rare and world renowned honey.

class3.name: Joe Mama's Milk
class3.description: Big Brother to our Mother’s Milk.  It starts with our Mother’s Milk recipe, we then add copious amounts of brown sugar to add body and increase the alcohol content.  Then, after primary fermentation, we infuse a cold coffee extract from our friends down the street, Monkey Joe’s Roasting Co.

class3.name: Trip V
class3.description: Trip V delivers the comfort of cocoa and vanilla with a bold cherry twist. Bolstered by chocolate and caramel malts, this beer pours dark, reddish brown. New Belgium Brewer Andrew Sturm decided to go big with all three spices but achieved balance through a moderate amount of bittering hops. The result is a satisfying blend of chocolate, cherry, and vanilla delivered on a sophisticated bed of hops and alcohol.

class3.name: Bourbon Barrel Night Fury with Vanilla Bean
class3.description: Bourbon barrel aged Night Fury imperial stout aged on Madagascar Vanilla Beans.

class3.name: Triplication
class3.description:
Based on the classic Belgian style Tripel, our version balances the spiciness from the Idle Hands house yeast with a complex mélange of banana, peach and pear notes. The light malt sweetness in the finish ensures you’ll go back for seconds, or perhaps thirds?!

Inspired by the classic Trappist Tripels, we wanted to create our own interpretation of it for everyone to enjoy. As this is our first “high gravity” offering we think you’ll agree that it is named appropriately. While it is meant as a sipping beer it will warm the body and soul as one waits with anticipation for warmer days to come.

class3.name: Headcracker
class3.description: An English style golden barley-wine brewed with English pale and German pilsener malts to lend a light biscuit flavour on the palate. This brew is hopped with the English hop varietal, First Gold to lend just enough bitterness to balance the malt notes. Cheers!

class3.name: Pepper Head
class3.description: A unique Texas twist on the American IPA style. A strong green chile aroma with a clean bitter finish.

class3.name: Great Commander
class3.description: The Great Commander is a Rum Barrel Imperial Stout spiced with cocoa, vanilla, cinnamon, cayenne, New Mexican Ancho Chile and serrano peppers. Flavors of chocolate, rum and vanilla meld together seamlessly with the perfect amount of spice and heat. The Great Commander is the spark setting fire to the hearts of the masses!

class3.name: Mad Meg
class3.description: “Provision Ale” is a rough translation of the French term “bière de provision“, which was sometimes used to describe special beers that were suitable for extended storage and aging. Brewed from relatively simple, straightforward ingredients, Mad Meg is golden colored and quite strong, at over 9% ABV. Its palate intertwines delicate farmhouse esters with earthy, spicy hops and clean malt flavors. The name “Mad Meg”, refers to a peasant woman from Flemish folklore, also known as “Dulle Griet” or “Dull Gret”, who leads an army of women to pillage hell. She’s famously depicted in Pieter Brueghel the Elder’s 1562 painting by the same name.

class3.name: Runaway Imperial IPA
class3.description: Runaway Imperial IPA is a high gravity ale that has a  pronounced hop aroma, with a refined malt body that balances the hop bitterness to achieve a smooth, yet flavorful, Imperial IPA!

class3.name: Thick Freakness Aged in Corn Whiskey Barrels
class3.description: Our biggest, boldness offering , Thickfreakness is made with rolled oats and wheat to give it an extra smooth mouth feel. Chocolatey & Brash

class3.name: Barrel Aged Old Rasputin
class3.description:
Every year we age a special batch of our much-loved Russian Imperial Stout in Bourbon barrels. The depth, intensity, and complexity of the flavor profile of this special release, like its predecessors, make it a worthy tribute to Old Rasputin.

Prior to 2010, Barrel-Aged Old Rasputin was released in such limited quantities that it was available only at the North Coast Brewing retail shop in Fort Bragg, California. However, we received so many requests for this beer that we began producing enough Barrel-Aged Old Rasputin to put into broader, but still limited, distribution.

class3.name: RuinTen IPA
class3.description: We first released this decidedly indelicate beer in 2012, as Stone Ruination Tenth Anniversary IPA, to celebrate the 10th anniversary of our belovedly bitter Stone Ruination IPA. Stone RuinTen IPA uses the same recklessly hoppy recipe as the 2012 release; only the name has changed, as we plan to unleash this belligerently delicious hop monster upon the public annually from now on. We packed a whopping five pounds of hops into each barrel, and cranked up the ABV to stand up to the hop onslaught. The results are glorious, and we know you'll rejoice in tasting this audacious gem of hoppy splendor once again. You're welcome.

class3.name: Veranda
class3.description: Veranda has a wonderfully complex aroma that stems from its blend yeast strains. The aroma is of green pepper, with some spiciness and dry dark fruits like raisins, plums and dates. The flavor has a supporting caramel malt that mixes with the slight toffee sweetness. The finish is fairly dry making it that much easier to drink and even though it is a big beer you would never know it. Staying true to style, Veranda has a slightly oxidized taste giving it somewhat of a rustic flavor.

class3.name: Maxxdout
class3.description: An imperial stout brewed with crisp American 2-Row malt and plenty of chocolate and roasted barley, then dry hopped with Amarillo and Centennial hops. Big, hoppy when fresh, and perfect for those wintry nights.

class3.name: The Mini Dingo
class3.description:
A Bottle Revolution Collaboration

min-i-din-go: The rarest of all wild-dog breeds. Canny. Elusive. Fearful of nothing.
Total in captivity: 1
Total bottles brewed: Not nearly enough! Only a beer so bold could pay tribute to the newest addition to the BTL REV pack. Call #holdsies on one before they are gone.

class3.name: Pumpkin Up The Jam
class3.description: This 10-barrel batch of Pumpkin Up The Jam will surely get your booty on the floor tonight. With 8.9% ABV, this fall-weather sipper is brewed with 80 pounds of pumpkins in the mash and is spiced with a custom blend of cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, clove and allspice from our friends at Fairhope Health Foods.

class3.name: Eschaton
class3.description:
ow about a big, malty beer that evokes a good red wine and with a drier finish than you’d expect at 10.5% ABV?
Eschaton is a one-of-a-kind oaked all-malt Quadrupel (or “Belgian Strong Dark” if you prefer) that abounds with dark fruit and pit fruit flavors as well as earthy spiciness. Vanilla oak and warm viniferous notes assert themselves as the beer warms to reveal additional layers of delicious complexity.

Style: Belgian-style Quadrupel Ale Aged on Pinot Noir Oak Chips

class3.name: Betelgeuse
class3.description: Red Giant Belgian-style Ale; oak-aged for 9 months.

class3.name: Voodoo Love Child
class3.description:
This is our Gran Met Ale aged on intimate Passion Fruit, Raspberry and Michigan Tart Cherry. Lightly spiced with passion. Light Reddish hue and with a alcohol strength of 10% and nicely carbonated in the bottle.

Again Bottle Conditioned and Fermented. 

Enjoy a couple and have your own Voodoo Love Child later!!!

class3.name: Papier
class3.description: Papier is our first anniversary ale, loosely brewed in the English-style Old Ale tradition using our house Belgian yeast strain. The traditional first anniversary gift is something made of paper. The Bruery is giving their loyal fans the gift of Papier, their first anniversary ale. Layered with complex flavors of dark fruit,vanilla, oak, and burnt sugar, Papier is a robust ale, surely the perfect beer to mark our first big milestone. Best for sharing, this beer is ideal for cellaring until you have a celebration of your own…if you can wait.

class3.name: Pacific Coast Brewing Leviathan Imperial Stout
class3.description: As black as pitch, this Russian style Imperial Stout brings warmth to weary and frigid souls everywhere. Dark, smooth, and roasty, this is the stout of Russian Czars! Brewed to withstand the long trip to Moscow from Great Britain. Took back to back Silvers at the 92 & 93 GABF.

class3.name: Graham Cracker Ale
class3.description: Through the addition of spices, vanilla and actual graham crackers, we feel we have achieved a classic winter warmer for the holiday season.

class3.name: Lips of Faith - Kick
class3.description:
New Belgium and Elysian are together again with Kick, a rich and tart pumpkin cranberry ale blended with wood-aged beer for a uniquely complex harvest season sour. The russet and orange of autumn shimmer through a slight haze like sunlight through the smoke from burning leaves. The taste and texture of pumpkin give way to the refreshing tang of cranberries and critters, satisfying and exciting with each swallow, finishing with an urge for more. 

Kim brought sour from New Belgium; Dick brought pumpkin from Elysian. You'll get a Kick out of their collaboration.

class3.name: The Details
class3.description:
The aroma contains hints of pear and white pepper with a soft malt character. The flavor holds similar complexity, masking the potent alcoholic strength. By maintaining a relatively low fermentation temperature, we were able to restrain the yeast expression. The resulting beer is very complex, but very drinkable.
Danger in a glass.

class3.name: Mother of all Storms
class3.description: There are many storms out there, all of them perfect in their own way. But there is only one Mother of all Storms and it only happens in Pacific City, Oregon. Based on Stormwatcher’s Winterfest, our English-style barleywine, Mother of all Storms spent many months aging in Kentucky bourbon barrels. Now at its peak, Mother of all Storms delivers deep flavors of toasted malt, bourbon and oak. The finish rewards with whispers of vanilla, toffee and caramel. Best enjoyed with gusts exceeding 60 mph.

class3.name: La Trappe Tripel
class3.description: A special and powerful Trappist. Including the use of coriander owes it its spicy character. Golden in color with a fruity, bittersweet taste.

class3.name: Antigoon's Revenge
class3.description: The fourth release in our Legendary Series revisits the Belgian story of Brabo vs. Antigoon, albeit in a reversal of roles. Brabo’s Cut, the first Legendary release, told the tale of a brave Roman soldier named Silvius Brabo and his heroic deeds. Growing tired of paying tolls to cross the river Scheldt, Brabo chopped off the hand of Antigoon, the menacing giant who guarded the bridge in the city of Antwerp, slaying him and collecting a mighty reward. Now centuries later, Antigoon is out for payback, bringing with him a fiery vengeance unlike any other. The antithesis of Brabo’s Cut, Antigoon’s Revenge is a traditional big, Belgian-Style Golden Ale, untraditionally brewed with a touch of cherry-wood smoked malt. At a hefty 12.4% ABV, it’s not for the faint of heart. Notes of sweet fruit and spicy esters come through in the aroma and initial taste, with wisps of smoke finishing on the palate. Revenge never tasted so sweet.

class3.name: Killer Angel
class3.description:
8 hop varieties, 8 hop additions. In order of appearance…. Warrior, Summit, Simcoe, Willamette, Cascade, and Falconer’s Flight in the boil, then two separate dry-hop additions of Centennial then Citra.

Don’t be afraid of this killer, though, because it is still angelic. It’s very smooth, balanced and quite quaffable.

class3.name: Easter Basket
class3.description: Our Mosaic Double IPA brewed with a twist - chocolate and coffee, for a taste unlike any other we have brewed before.

class3.name: Monsoon
class3.description: For all of you Hop-Heads out there! Hopped with Tim Etter’s home grown Mt. Hood and Cascade hops.

class3.name: Eminent Double IPA
class3.description: A big, hoppy beer with a full aroma and a wonderful blend of hops. The 5 hop additions make this a bitter beer, but is balanced with the high gravity.

class3.name: Imperial Pumpkin Ale
class3.description:
This batch is fermented with an ale yeast as opposed to last year's lager batch.

Our Brandy Barrel-Aged Imperial Pumpkin Ale pays homage to Lakefront’s formative years and to our Wisconsin roots. It pours a copper-orange with a fine, off-white head. The aroma is caramel-forward, followed by cinnamon, vanilla, nutmeg, oak, and subtle brandy notes. The full, moderately bright mouthfeel starts with cinnamon, nutmeg, and caramel malt, then yields Madagascar vanilla bean, oak, and brandy flavors.
